text:
I would said this restaurant is unique in many ways. The cuisine, the setting of the restaurant, the attention of owner make the place great to eat. There are gluten free item and grass feed beef as their advertisements of the material of the food. 

I like to mention a little about their sound system. It is front row seat to the concert. The restaurant invest a very good sound system that is pleasure to the ear. They also hide their speaker very well. Imagine they play the Star Wars music. May the force be with you. 

We have order the taste of the islands and the blacken mango salmon. The taste of the island include curry goat, Ox tail and jerk chicken. The goat is a bit heavy smell. The jerk chicken is great with the seasoning they have. The best is the Ox Tail. The Ox tail with Caribbean spice make this dish special.

The blacken salmon is prepare with Caribbean blacken spice. It is very nice. It serves over cook pineapple sauce. The fish is tasty. This dish accompanied with a side salad. The desert we have is the coconut cake. The coconut cake has layers of coconut cream. It is guilty pleasure. 

The greeting of the owner from the restaurant make this place special. The decorations is modern and it is gear up for upper class power lunch or dinner. Nice touch. Service is great and the cook is the owner wife. It is family run with attention to the details.

Base on the affordable price, great food, and good service, this is considering 5 stars restaurant. 

We have yelp group enjoy our time and food here. Since we have 7 in the group, we have ordered the Family Dinner. It is a whole chicken with salad, fried yuca, and cilantro rice. The salad is fresh with vinaigrette dressing. I like the cilantro rice with spice in rice. The chicken is marinated and slowly roasted with the skin is crispy outside. We have added the tostones - the flatten fried green plantain for other member to experience the food. 

We also ordered the Cuenellis Special - Palomilla Steak with fried egg. The steak is well season and tasty, however, the steak may need to be tenderizing for better chewing. The dish also come with fried yuca, 1/4 chicken and fried sweet plantain. A lot food for affordable meal.

This is my special review for a single vender in the French Market. The reason that they need special attention is due to the unique food that they are prepared. If you visit the French Market, do not miss up the opportunity to try their food. Their vender stand is located at the last vender stand of the food venders at first open air structure. It is very much at the middle of two open air structures. 

They occupied three vender stands and a front open air stand. You will not miss it. The front vender stand offers the roast cone and broil peanut. They roasted their corn in the enclose smoker. Once they receive the order, they will peel off the skin and show the ear. Then they will dip the corn to the hot butter, and season with salt, parmesan cheese (yum), Cajun spice (wow). My wife loves this corn. The inner vender stand serves the deep fried corn, crab cake, gator bites, and frog leg. They also serve different type of fruit drink and icy. We were curious the deep fry corn did not turn to pop corn. The vender owner assures us it will not happen. Evidently, it does not and coated with thin cajun coating. I have concluded the deep fried corn is a boy food and the roast corn is girl food base on the preference.

We also order the home made crab cake. The surprise is not the crab cake; it is the side dish that comes with it. The deep fried kale. I have the deep fried kale at the Cool Bean restaurant in Tallahasse FL. I did not expect they are as good as the restaurant grade. The Kale is deep fried for 30 second then season. The best thing is when you put on the tongue and the kale melt like cotton candy. The vender did a very good job.

I am using this restaurant to mark my 100 review. This will be the restaurant I will likely repeat when I come back to New Orleans. This is one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. Each reservation or walk in is allowed for 1.5 hours dining in the prime evening by the restaurant. The restaurant offer blue music while eating. The musician is very good and talented. They can kick into high gear or take it slow like Big Easy. 

This restaurant located Marigny area. This is a hypies area. Many people around this area are care free. But the restaurant is considered a high end even though they are located in this area. We love the performance by the musician. The guitar and harmonica have their solo highlight display the talented tune. The singer also great and the song is about the daily life. 

Tonight we have order the Two Run Farms Lamb Sliders, Beer Braised Kurobuta Pork Belly, Bleu Cheese Stuffed Dates, Seared Scallops, Crab Dra Diavolo Cannolloni and Deviled Yard Egg. Most of the dishes have a choice of small or large quantity. Our first dish is the Deviled Yard Egg. The egg filling include seasoned egg yolk. It garnish with seasoned chop vege and top with deep fry broccoli flower. You will experience with crispy, sweet vege, and salty paste taste. The second dish Bleu Cheese Stuffed Dates. The Dates wrap in bacon and drizzle with sweet vanilla balsamic vinaigrette. The Bleu Cheese is stuff in the Dates and the combination allow for salty first then sweet (bacon to sweet dates). The third dish is  pork belly. This is my favorite dish in the restaurant. The pork belly is slice in rectangular cube. They pork belly is actually braise to soft the texture then slightly sear at the outside. It place on Chinese flat bread and garnish in the pickle cucumber. When you place the pork belly at your tongue, you can feel the pork belly fat actually melt away. This is actually a Chinese technique to cook the pork belly in pressure cooker and braise in slow fire. This is a dish should not miss. The fourth dish is the Crab Dra Diavolo Cannolloni. This is fresh pasta with spicy crab meat filling. It is cook with tomato sauce with caper.  The pasta is refreshing. The fifth dish is the Lamb Slider. The lamb meat is grounded and seasoned. It cooks over the open flame and top with tomato creamy sauce. The last dish is the seared scallop. The scallop is seared and serve with charizo, red lentils and bok chai. 

Overall we enjoy the great music over the meal. I have order the local brewer beer - southern pecan beer. It is great to go with the meal. The service is great. I am award this restaurant with five star to start my 3 digit review.

It is good start for the poke work. They are ready on first day. The entire crew able to serve customers at the first day. Method and ingredients are correct. Pokeworks located at the mall near the food court. 

I did take advantage on their grand opening special but one get one free. We have free samples of the sorbet ice while we wait on the line. I like their choices on the base, ingredients, topping. At the base they have a choice that no poke place has it yet - the kale noodle. It is delicious. On the topping, they have and item like fried slice lotus root. That is unique at it on way. 

In addition, they mix the ingredients separately with sauce or flavor. Their worker are well train and costume to your order. They ask you you want light, medium or heavy sauce. It give you adjustment for not too sweet or salty of your food. Great choice. I am a fan for this poke. Many other poke store need to learn from them.

Great bakery at the Hillsborough Ave and Sheldon. This bakery is kind hidden at the corner and very difficult to find. It is on the south east corner or the plaza. It has an outdoor red umbrella and Columbia flag in front of the store. 

If you are here, got to try their ice coffee. They use whole milk or 2% milk to stir up with mocha coffee. It use food processor to grind the ice and coffee and milk. Very delicious. 

The pastry is another best. Got to try their sweet corn and cheese item. The pastry includes beef and chicken fluffy pastry. Other than it. It has many pastry to select. Some thing sweet or salty. 

Price are affordable. Many Columbian has done here. The store server know a little English only. So point you finger. Don't worry about price. You will love and they are affordable.

I have seen one of the elite member friend review this restaurant and want to come here to check it out. The restaurant is far away from any interstate. However, it is worth a trip for taste and unique of the food. 

This restaurant only has three elite members review including me. This restaurant needs to make know. I would say this is a very creative on taste and combination of the ingredient. 

We have Ahi Poke, Out of Control Roll, Tampa Roll, and Spicy Tuna Roll. The Ahi Poke is Ahi tuna seared with shichimi pepper and tossed w. hot sesame oil, sriracha sauce, scallions, and masago. Served on crispy wonton chips, and avocado. It is a bit spicy but the preparation of the roll requires time in cooking, chopping, assembling, and decorating. It top with eel sauce and set on the fried wonton skin and make a beautiful presentation. 

The out of control roll is never out of control. The flavor is well control and sophisticate. This roll is tuna, salmon, kani & avocado inside, tuna, salmon & yellow- tail w. mayo & seared across, caviar on top w. eel sauce and scallion. This roll require dear across the roll top with eel sauce and masago. This is another creation of the chef. 

I would recommend order from the Uchi special roll section if you are here. The service is good. This place is a bit pricy but worth the money to try special roll.

Authentic cuisine number 59. Philippine cuisine. 

This restaurant is close to low side of 4.5 stars. I see many potential potential for this restaurant. They have many good things going on this food truck. I round them to 5 stars. 

If you come here, you got to try their halo halo. Their halo halo is different than most Philippino cuisine. The bean and jelly are home made. The juice is jackfruit juice. Very special. Best halo halo in town. 

This food truck is popular here. A lot of customers. They do have the seating area. But I rather take it to go during pandemic. The menu changes every day. When they sold out they will not continue make it until next day. 

We got the Bistek. It is sirloin beef steak simmering in soy sauce. The serve with rice and lumpia. I would only give them an average on this dish. The second dish is much better choice. It is the sautéed mung bean. It serve with the fried scad fish. The bean is one of the kind. I would recommend this dish. Fish is good. You have to chose tail or head section.

I am glad they finally think about northern Tampa. Zoe's new location definitely will bring a lot revenue to the company. Because Dale Mabry Carrollwood area is definitely a restaurant pocket. With that said, I think will be a good contributor to the community with great food with easy selection. 

I like the new restaurant with outside seating that allow many dog owners gladly visit the restaurant. This is a plus in many way just by sacrificing a few parking space with outside seating. 

The restaurant Mediterranean cuisine has a lot to offer. You can have kabob, bowl, sandwich, pita, salad, and piadinas. We got the salmon bowl with Mediterranean Salad Trio. I am good with that. The best is salmon kabob with roasted veggies and quinoa. This is very good dish. The salmon is fresh and grilled very well. I like roasted veggies with a lot flavor. I would go for double roasted veggies incomparable to quinoa. 

The manager did make around our table to see how is our food. I also like to suggest the Mediterranean Lamb Kafka as starter if you happen to visit them.

They actually do not have the buffet. We were there thinking they have the buffet. But they have the tali plate. Which is better to my opinion. 

We got the meat tali. It has a lot of chamber to fill the plate. I like it because the appetizers also meat. My two entrees is the mutton curry and the fish curry. These two curry were very good. Especially the mutton curry Kat fresh out the kitchen. Tasty. I also like the fried chicken curry. It has a lot character. The rice has biryanis rice and good chicken in it. 

Not much of service. When yo finish the plate, they ask you dump it your self. By food is excellent.

Yelping No. 2500. 
This one go to local restaurant Harvest Bowl. I believe they have very good potential. The place is great to to visit since they converted fro paint store to restaurant with huge space. This place includes eatery and food market. I like the concept. The only down side is not much of seating area. Very limited due to space fill with groceries items. 

I got the Asian fusion bowl with grilled salmon. The salmon was excellent. The sauce in the bowl is tasty. I like mixture of ingredients. My wife got the building your own bowl with BBQ chicken and pull chicken. She like her bowl. She like the Brussels sprouts. We also got meat pie. I recommend you get that if they have it. We also got the cheese cake. They have many selections of cheese cake. The cheese taste light which is the way I love.

My first visit is five stars and my second visit is 4 stars. They should be around 4.5 stars. Not a try 5 stars restaurant. They restaurant seating capacity is a little to less. They do have back door outside seating area and front outdoor seating area. This is a chain restaurant originated from California. It combine many cuisine street food and on display in single restaurants. 

Who thought changing the shape of the churro and add topping bring may like customers. We have chocolate sprinkles churro. It was interesting. I like the popcorn chicken. The five spice coating is really nice. We got our entree as garlic noodle shaken beef. The beef is really shaken for the first time visit. Bit repetitive second time visit they over cook it. The fillet mignon pho is more torn down from Vietnamese version. But still good. Pad see ew is good but it in Thai standard. Overall food is good. 

The fruity booty slush is highly recommended. The other drink pink flamingo is good too. Overall service is good.

This review has five stars only because of their lunch special. It is actually an 4.5 stars. It is good value on weekday lunch special. Most roll is about $5. Even they are $5, each roll come with 8 pieces. The lunch special is from Monday to Friday. During lunch time, they have quite number of customers. 

I got the vegetable roll, Cougar roll, Lava roll, Mexican roll and eel cucumber roll. The best is cougar roll. It is spicy tuna with sweet seaweed and top with smelt roe. The tuna grade is excellent. The next one I like is lava roll with spicy crab on California roll top with shiracha sauce. 

They may be not five star if I come at night time and pay more because I expect better. Obviously the dinner is still needed to be evaluated. The service is just right. Did not make me jump up my seat. But the quality of the food is good.

In search of Taco in the Bay Area. Taco is thriving in this restaurant. The name really attract many people to be here. I just wonder who will be the taco father. I like the name of the restaurant reflect their food of serving. 

Tonight we did not try other combination but just taco. Since tonight is week night, we order the taco on the board. The steak, grilled pork, cow tongue, pork in green salsa. I like the steak taco. You know they have good taco because the steak is not pre-cook and re-cook when people order (the meat will be too dry). As a result the meat is tender and juicy. I heard they have the shrimp taco special on Friday. I will be back to try that. 

They are about 4.5 stars restaurant in my opinion. I award them to five stars due to a lot of meat is pack to one taco, juicy, great taste, nice garnish. I like the meat is likely season not over power and still can taste the steak is the important key factor. This review only for their taco not other combination dish. I would try their quesadilla next time I am here.

Rare Ethnic Food #73. Ethiopian Cuisine. 

Queen of Sheba is the best African restaurant you can find in Tampa Bay. Love it. The mixture of the spice and taste is very harmonious good. Expect waiting for the food because is popular. The owner is very friendly. Treat you like her family.

We got the sampler to share and add a lamb tip. The sampler has three meats and three veggies. The three meats including two chicken and one beef. We add Queen Lamb Tip. All the meat is cook with different flavor. I like all of them. The lamb is good. I also like the veggies. Very good use of spice in each veggies to create the dish. Love the creativity of the veggies. You also can ask the share plate to be all veggies. 

The best way to eat it is by hand. Use the injera to pick up the food. My cheated with requested folk and knife. Which is not normally done.

Rare Authentic Cuisine 63, Xi'an Cuisine 

Finally, I can say there is a great hand pull noodle in Tampa. And!! It is at my neighborhood. Finally the wait is over, and I was able to eat in the restaurant. The restaurant name in Chinese is "Old Taste". I believe it old method long pass through generations and come to US. Xi'an cuisine is famous on flat noodle, beef rougamo , or hand pull noodle. Love it. 

We start with the beef rougamo - beef pita. The beef is slice beef shank with spicy marinated. I've the beef. I may not necessarily like the pita. We also got the Yummy chicken nuggets. The coating is panko crispy with a bit of Cummings. 

Our main dish is braise beef hand pull noodle. This is the one I recommend. The beef was well marinated and keep the juicy meat taste. The hand pull noodle has very good texture. By the way, it is spicy. The final dish is the chicken with dry chili. It has good high BTU wok technique. Next time, we will order the broil fish with bean sprouts. 

I can say the restaurant is 4.5 stars. Items can improve is provide the menu to read instead scan bar code and find the menu in the phone. I rather have real menu. They are still on try out. The speed of the food delivery to the table may need to be faster.

For fast food, this is a good model. In term of food, kitchen, and customer relations. This criteria was use to rate their quality and value. They are about 4.5 stars to my experience. It is good fast food model. I have been to their sister restaurant in the mall, and now the independent building, it is a lot better setting compared to the mall. 

Food- I think they have good high end food with medium price. The choices also better than other location. Food is tasty. We got the shrimp poboy. Good number of shrimp. One thing surprised me is their fried chicken strips have very good coating. 
Kitchen- it bigger kitchen than mall food court. Output of the food was in good rate. Food come out quick. Chef also better. Please keep up the good work. 
Customer relations- the have good service. Very friendly from order to food delivery to table and check on customer need. 

One thing strikes me is they have a hand wash station. I like that feature if you need to wash your hand without going to the restroom. It is convenient. They host movies night on the lawn for family which is a plus.

Rare Ethic Food No. 17

I have come to here often because they have oriental bakery. Oriental bakery is different than French or American bakery. Material and ingredients is a lot different. The sweetness is really tone down compared to Latin bakery. 

Fortune Star is famous fruit sponge cake. It is definitely different than traditional sponge cake. It is fluffy and very lightly sweet. In between the cake layer is the fruit filling. Cool whip topping with very nice and beautiful design. The basic 10" sponge cake is $25. Need minimum one day before order. Average they make 20 cake a day. So call early to order. The different filling such taro filling is extra. 

Other than their famous cake. They sell cut off pieces if you like to try. The also have Chinese bake bun. They include BBQ pork bun, curry bun, egg custard bun. Other than the bun, they have wife bean cake, sun cake and red bean cake. Go check them out.

Rare Authentic Food No. 23

I Ai Sushi is authentic Japanese street food. Of course the sushi is available. But there are other dish available. Since this is mom and pop shop. The owners are the waitress. I saw some reviews in the past. I think they have changed their system a lot since then. 

Before it they have menu in Japanese and customers take a lot of time try to understand what they eat. Now they just have pictures at the entrance and you order and paid at the entrance. Easier and cut down the time try to explain and make the process slow. 

We have order the Ramen and grilled squid. The squid was slice after grilled and go with their home made sauce. The ramen is close to what we have eat in Japan. As a result we like their authenticity.

Top Golf is top of the world at third level bay. It is gorgeous beautiful golf outing. Thanks to yelp friends invite, we have experienced firsthand 3D golf with games system. This is one of the golf courses you can know about your driving golf ball distance. 

It doesn't matter it rain or shine, this place can handle both conditions. We were there when Tampa has been rain for a week. I actually like to play when it rain in summer time. Summer in Tampa for outdoor is brutal even with the sun down. Rain actually cools it down for this cover open air activities. 

We like the food there with bite can be share with many people. We have steak flat bread, Mushi, and buffalo chicken slider. The Mushi is chicken roll in jalapeño tortilla. They have many pieces to share. I would consider they have many selection of the party food. 

My friend shows me the games system of the golf. I am just a recreation golfer may be golf 1 time every three years. You will know I am not the skill golfer. My friend indicate to me that is better for me since I am not the serious golfer and I will enjoy more in Top Golf games. Serious golfers loose the fun of this place since they ask for their perfection of their skill. 

They also have games indoor with pool table, games console with motion and more. The games are free inside.  However, the price of golf is double after 6 pm.

I like to thank Nick S. for the notice to this restaurant. It located at Temple Terrace northwest corner of Whiteway Drive and 56 street the Temple Terrace Village Plaza. This is Peruvian restaurant. The restaurant owner are Elizabeth and her husband. Her husband is the cook. The restaurant just started December 26 2014. Elizabeth is from Columbia and her husband is from Peru. Peruvian grilled meat is very tasty. 

The lunch and dinner menu seem like the same. We have order the Falda and Lomo de Cerdo - grilled skirt steak and grilled pork chop tenderloin. The Falda is equivalent to Churrasco in Argentine dish. The meat should be at the low section of cow a long flat cut of skirt steak from the "plate" of the cow. The skirt steak is actually diaphragm muscle of the cow but in low section. Some one may serve you the skirt steak on the upper section which not as good as the low section. This restaurant also serve the upper section skirt steak dish call Vacio. Which is internal flank plate. Today the Falda came with the home made chimichurri sauce. You also allow to select one side. I have select the sweet plantain. All dish came with salad in the plate. To eat Falda, cut along the meat to the direction of the meat grain with small strip. You will enjoy more with cut since the Falda come in strip against the meat grain. I can finally said I found a reasonable price churrasco that comparable to Cuban churrasco that serve in Miami ($18.95) at Tampa. My wife dish is the grill pork chop. Seem like the preparation is first fried then grilled. The pork chop is marinate with rosemary, salt and pepper. This chop is good since they are sealing meat juice when they prepare it. 

Overall the restaurant is not busy and you get the service from the owner. A few thing they may be able to improve is have the lunch menu price that can attract more customer. Adding the pre-meal item such as bread or soup. The decoration of the restaurant display the mozaic of the local Peruvian art and painting. The restaurant back door is open to ventilating the food smell. So pick the seat close to the front to avoid food smoke.

Interesting setting of the restaurant that show the picture of musician. They have live music on Thursday, Friday and Sunday. We were very lucky that we have a seat immediately. We were here when Genghis Flan playing here. Parking is challenge since the restaurant have a lot of traffic. If you come after 7:00 pm, you can park at the value pawn shop after they close. 

Tonight dinner we have begin with crab stuffed butternut squash. Butternut squash is a very difficult cooking material to be use, however, the chef did a very good job to prepare it with crab meat and citrus hollandaise source. The squash filled with crab meat area is extremely soft and sweet to eat. 

Our main course is chicken mole and beef tenderloin. The chicken is very juicy in curry source top over comb read arepa. Who can think about the combination of the dish. It is getting better with the preparation on the beef tenderloin. The dish come with 2 pieces of 4 oz tenderloin in port wine source. It grilled to perfect with beef juice seal inside. This dish also come with bacon wrap asparagus. Bacon is good with any food but who can think the combination of crispy bacon wrap with bacon juice drip into the asparagus. It also come with mash potato cake. The mash is well season and the top is bake to crispy. 

I am usually not given out 5 star. The cooking and the mixture of the material and taste is well balance. The food give me a wow and unique factor.

Cool temple. Very colorful. I remember when I was at the Chiangmai, the Buddha is plated with actual sheet of gold paper. I wonder they do it here. 

We were here many time for the Sunday morning Thai market and eateries. I like this place because it serve my home country neighbor country food. It is very similar to my country. The food here very similar to the vendors of Friday night market in my home country. Only different is you have to wait on line to order. 

Always come here with two people or more. You need to divide and conquer. The noodle line is long. Here one person in line while the other person go to buy other food. Always put your name down on the coconut ball and it will be ready before you leave the market. Once you got some of the food, feed the person in line for noodle then go get the drink for Thai tea, longan drink or coconut drink. Once got the drink go back to the noodle line to help the bowl of soup noodle. This is always our strategy for this market.  

The soup noodle is the best. It is very light food. They have thin, medium or widest noodle size to chose. You can chose beef or pork base noodle. 

I also like their dessert. Many to chose from. Grill chicken, steak or pork stick is grilled on the spot. The also have wok cook food like the curry, pad Thai and more. 

The best time is November to December and March to May. When it is not too hot. The weather is pleasant. At special event, they perform the Thai traditional dance.

My first visit is about 4 stars but my second visit is 5 stars. This make this restaurant is about 4.5 stars. The first visit with spicy tuna and salmon is grind meat. I really not a fan of it. I like many choices of the ingredients to be add on. Only a few need additional money. Which is I can skip. 

My last visit is the restaurant did give me freedom to separate the rice from the ingredients and sauce. Allow me just to mixed the ingredients only. I also like just select the Ahi tuna and salmon without add into premixed spiciness. This is much better quality because the tuna is dice close to a inch cube. Big size for mixed your on poke. I give them an A in this matter. By separating the ingredients from rice make this mixed more flavorful. Now I can combine many sauces with the raw fish and ingredients. Some of the ingredients included crab salad, corn, mango, red cabbage, cucumber, edamame, masago and more. These are the ingredients included part of the bowl price. 

I would love to have the sweet eel sauce, ponzu sauce and poke sauce to add together. This is my favorite mixed sauce. At the end you add the fried onion and fried garlic to add the crunchy and extra taste. 

Overall experience is great. We have party of eight and enjoy our moments of poke. This place also has hibachi and sushi burrito.

This is interesting Peruvian restaurant. They serve a special dish of the beef heart. It is a delicacy item that slice into pieces and grilled. Ana M is kind to let me try this dish. Be brave and order this appetizer. It tastes like regular beef meat. Thank to Steve to organize the UYE Latin Crawler to get to know this restaurant the first time. 

The ambient is nice and the restaurant is pack with people during lunch time. We have the free sample on the appetizer with potato or fried yucca in cream cheese sauce. I like the yucca with cream cheese. 

My entree is fried fish top with shrimp, mussel, and squid in fish broth. The restaurant did a good job on the on the fish broth. If you use the can fish broth, you need to be careful on the saltiness in the mix. This restaurant is balance their broth with a good technique not to overpower the taste and maintain light level of salty. The squid is well prepared with the softness of the texture. The shrimp count may be in the range of 10 to 15 counts a pound which means larger shrimp. When the restaurant prepares seafood you are looking for the fresh material. The seafood is really fresh and keeps in the quality. 

This is a restaurant serve a lot ceviche, Peruvian stir fried or deep fried. I would said they are definite are very good on this end. I have not tried their grilled meat dish and that is yet to come. Service is a bit headache since we have a group of 30. They may be able to improve at in this end when they facing busy condition.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet truly 5 stars. It is one of the best BBQ in Bay Area. This food truck hold it place of many BBQ I had. It has very interesting side order. The selection is very special. 

The order I got is a three meats combo. This dinner come with sides. The two we have is the blue crab yellow rice with shrimp and collard green. Other side that in menu choices are truffles Mac n Cheese, Yukon potatoes, baked bean, smoked candies yum, dirty yellow rice. All the choices is great selection. The three meats are the smoke rib, pull pork, and corn beef brisket. The corn beef brisket is moist and tender. 

The food truck is popular, many customers. It is popular place for the local.

Rare Ethnic Food 4 - Malaysian Cuisine. 

Finally we have some restaurant actually represent my country well in Tampa. There are three claiming Malaysian restaurants in Bay Area. This one may be the best representing. Although the restaurant introduce a lot of pan Asia food, but predominantly is Malaysian street food. The Chinese has immigrated to Malaysia long time ago. A mix marriage with local Malay people and create a generation call Nyonya. This people combine the Chinese cuisine and Malay cuisine and ultimately have this mix cultural food. 

Laksa is one of the good example. This spicy soup base rice noodle dish is created of the combination of the Chinese rice noodle in the use of Malay lemon grass material. The Prawn Mee is another example. The soup base is spicy Malay spice from shrimp shell and head. The noodle, pork, slice of shrimp are Chinese touch. 

Char Kway Teow is stir fry flat rice noodle. In Malaysia you can ask them to add the sambal - spicy shrimp paste in the noodle. It make more interesting. Have you try the Roti Canai. In Malaysia, this item is a hand craft. The chef actually has to stretch this dough to thin piece and pan fried on the hot plate grill. In Malaysia you can ask them to add egg, goat meat, onion. Can you feel the gulai (Malay for curry) of the Roti is different then any curry. It is different from Indian or Thai curry. The spice for Malaysian curry is sophisticate because they use wet curry powder. 

I would encourage you step out from your comfort zone to try this Malaysian dish including the mee goreng, Hokkkien mee. Unfortunately the satay here is still not close enough per Malaysian standard. I was able to give them 5 stars is to make sure the Orlando kitchen crews have left and they can stand their own ground to support this store. They did not disappoint me. They are quite good. Food came out in amazing speed.

This is food truck turn restaurant. I am applauded for their success transformation. They have a big menu for selection. The restaurant has big table shareable. The order is at the counter and bring to your table. 

The menu selection includes classic sushi roll, sushi and sashimi, special sushi roll, and appetizers. This is our second stop, so we only go for the appetizers. We got the Flaming Escolar and the Baked Green Mussels. The flaming escolar is torch with open flame and top with avocado. I like burn taste of the escolar. The sauce is excellent to go with it. The baked green mussels is chop and mixed with imitation crab meat. It is delicious after the baked. I like to pick up the small pieces and eat it slowly. 

The price is not cheap for the appetizers. But the experience rewards the outcome. I would said about 4.5 stars. Their sushi doesn't need any wasabi or soy sauce. It is already prepared to your likeness.

Yelping #1200

One word Excellent-Chef. You can't said two words. But food that good you said in one word. 

Lure was in my target for some time. One of my non Yelp friend told me about this place. Plus when you have priority list of the restaurant in you book mark with added distance to travel here, we take me 7 month to hit this book mark. But no regrets and I will return. Blame on Todd and Melissa hidden this place very well :) Can believe I bum to them while I visit. 

Now about the restaurant. I like the concept of tapas and open garage. The tapas is very close to small plate. For two people 3 dish is enough but it does not stop you to order more. Instead of spending money for two dish at most restaurant, here you can try one more dish. I also like the open garage drink area with pool table. It make this place lively. 

The skill of the chef. We have order the Miller, Kevin and Destin. We started with The Kevin with Blacken Redfish. The fish was handle well. Most chef either charcoal or not blacken enough. This chef make it just right. Blacken spice burn but not charcoal. The accompanying black-eyes pea and grit is good match. The Destin mixer of seared fillet tip, spice shrimp and sausage (soppressata) make this dish over the top. The many step preparation make this dish great to taste and put in the creamy pasta. My favorite is the miller. You can kill for this dish. The duck breast was marinated and blacken. A good duck breast need to cook roughly at medium rare to medium. The reason is medium rare is too chewy and the medium is to well done. This one just right. It has meaty bite but not chewy. Good technique. I am not going elaborate the accompanying side. Go find out yourself. 

Service is good. Love the atmosphere and food. Can't wait to return.

Rare Ethnic Food #34

This Mediterranean Cuisine but specialty on Syrian food. Syrian Cuisine is a bit different than Lebanese. They are similarity but alway minor differences. The Syrian has more heavy spice that I like. It actually marinated into the meat. 

The special item we had is not the so call "Babaghanoush", it call Mtable. It is grilled eggplant, tahini sauce, yogurt and garlic. It drizzle with olive oil. I love this dish. We have the mixed grill with Shish Tawook (chicken cube), Shish Kefta (grilled ground beef) and Shish Kabab ( Beef or Lamb cube) I like the marinated, it went deep into the meat. They have the best chicken cube in town. We also have the grilled fish sandwich which is less than $6. Great value. Fish fillet is big. Love it. 

This restaurant own by husband and wife. Please give them a visit, you will like it.

Mother of all food truck. The best ever. The owner is smart to create the good Hawaiian cuisine selection. I concur they deserve to be Yelp top 100 list. I will vote for them again for next year. 

I have seen many of friend great review on this food truck. I finally located them and paid them a visit. My favorite is the huli huli chicken. The chicken is well marinated and grilled perfectly. I like their side with ginger slaw, Mac slaw, kimchi rice, and coconut rice. All in good flavor. 

I learn that you can call ahead for your order and pick it up. The food truck in rotation everyday. Please check their face book page for location. I also order the mix plate and the short rib. The food are excellent. If you have not paid them a visit, you are missing it out.

4.5 stars in my book. Not yet fully 5 stars. This Italian restaurant is frequently visit by movie stars who is Italian descendants. This tell their Italian food is close to Italian taste. It almost can said "it is like my mom cooking". For for Asian like me I cannot tell what is truly Italian food. I only can judge what is good on the table. 

We order the Fratelli Special pizza. It has pepperoni, sausage, meatball, mushroom, onion and black olives. We got the  12" pizza. The pizza was delicious and the ingredients is nice not like typical pizza. We also got the garlic knots. It is dry at the bottom with good garlic and cheese sprinkled all over. We also got the  finger food an old bay wings. The owner was nice enough to give us extra three wings to make up the size is too small. 

If you have budget, or just one a slice of pizza ( they by slice too), or good Italian food. You may found your choice.

Just to open this review. This is a 4.5 stars Indian restaurant. It has good use of spice, good enough spiciness, good enough meat dish, great choice of dishes. Since there is no 1/2 stars, I given them five stars. 

It is good to see somethings different along the Bruce B Down. This restaurant come in to replace typical restaurants along this street. Price is reasonable on the lunch buffet. The food is fresh and cook very well. We have the goat curry. They do not have heavy goat smell which is perfect. The chicken masala is good curry to go with rice or the nan. Their nan is not at the buffet tray which is I agree, they bring fresh from their kitchen which is a smart move. Somethings different from the other Indian food buffet is they provide the dosa to the table. It is good. 

Service is good and attentive. So far not many people know about it yet. But the crowd is coming soon.

About 4.5 stars. Not yet true 5stars. Love the smiling face of store owner. The waitress may need some training. Our order was corrected by the owner of the restaurant while the waitress took the inconsistent order. This is local popular place to be. Many come here to dine in. If not the take out is a lot and busy. 

We started with yellow tail roll. It is simple and good. The best is the special of the day. They have high grade yellow and salmon crudo. The dish have 4 slice of yellowtail and 4 slice of salmon. It top with different masago and bed with seaweed salad. It was delicious. 

We also has the tempura udon. The tempura was big by it own with fried shrimp. The udon also good. The food experience win us there. I would suggest look for the special at the wall. That will be your best choice.

This restaurant was open just before the stay home order during pandemic. I was thinking very much to visit and finally they open for take out. We need to support our local business during this time. Especially good food. Michi is the first ramen near my area (new Tampa). 

We got the miso and Tonkutsu black garlic ramen. You can have two other choices such as regular or spicy oil and paste. The soup base is great. The porch egg is well prepared. The charshu pork are thick enough and well braise. 

We also got the pork bun and ikamaru grilled squid. The charshu pork bun is a bit pricy. Bun is good not the best in Tampa bay but close enough. The ikamaru probably is the best I have. The squid is a bit small in compare to many place. 

This is about 4.25 stars in my book. But I like to support our local ramen and I round up to 5 stars.
Mistaken update. See first review

It's about 4.5 stars restaurant. This restaurant located in Community cannel dock. All seat is outdoor. The restaurant allow dog to accompany their owner in the restaurant. This convenience attract a lot of dog owner bring your dog to the restaurant. It is dog friendly restaurant.

We brought our dog and my family to enjoy the view and food. Since the restaurant is very close to the water, they has a fresh seafood that you can choose. We got the blackened grouper, fried oyster, burger, and fish taco. They did the blacken very well with the flavor that I like. The coating of the fried oysters was very nice. The oysters are also  bigger size compared to many oyster we have eaten. 

The restaurant provide a bowl of water for the dog. The only thing that they can improve on is to make the shade and umbrella a little bigger.

I have revisited this restaurant 4 times. I have decided to give the update. This definitely the Peruvian restaurant that is expert with grilled meat. The dishes I like are the Falda, Picanha, Lomo de Cerdo. Several people of my friend have tried their ribs and they like it. 

If you come with a group of three, you can order the mix grill platter to share and you will have a chance for each type of meat. The Picanha is a bit salty but the marinated spice is well done into the meat. The best dish is still the Falda. 

They have the lunch special now use 10 to 12 dollars. I like the full portion better. 

The Chicha Morada is improving from my previous visit. The trick is telling them not to put too much ice in the cup before they pour it. The taste will be more Peruvian bean taste when they did that.

Movie night at the citrus park mall. It close at 2 am in the morning. It offer late night snack and beer. They all day beer special and after 10 pm special. At certain day they have all you can eat wings or tacos. 

The night we have visit they have combo special 2 people for $30. Very good deal. In the combo plater, it has 5 types of grilled meat. Pork rib, petite sirloin, smoke wings, grilled chicken breast and sausage. It also come with grilled onion and wedge potatoes. This item serves over the fire grill that keep the food warm. The grille has center plate to heat up the food. I like this way because many BBQ place has combo. At the of combo, the remaining food get cold. However, the device they have in this restaurant keep warm and heat up in the middle of grill. 

I would give them 5 stars for the food taste, keep warm on the combo, good service, nice open dinning hall, great price on the alcohol. I got 22oz Miller lite for $5.5.

Yelping 1700. Rare Specialty Food no. 44. 

Sweet Soul is new and coming special dessert shop that have variety of great item to offer in South Tampa. I am glad that make good use of that space. Have you heard about bee pollen, goji berry, hemp seed. This is the healthy food that serve in food conscious store. 

They have ACAI bowl, frozen yogurt. We were here for the frozen yogurt. Before we come, our friend already recommended this place. I am joining their train to recommend other to try their food. Their yogurt flavor is interesting. They have charcoal vanilla, chocolate, and some time mocha. I was never try charcoal vanilla. It is black color in very good way. I would recommend to go for the bowl instead of cup. Because the give 2 bases, 3 toppings, and one dusting. 

Guess what we have charcoal vanilla and. Chocolate swirl. The base is raspberry and dragon fruit. The toppings is bee pollen, ginger sugar, and mocha cookie. The dusting is agave sweet syrup. This combination is exquisite. The moment you taste it, you love it immediately.

It is 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. Mel has a good BBQ and they they located at good spot not too far from the I-275. A lot people here for the ribs and turkey leg. The selection is not much but it does enough for the menu. The main reason they are good rating is they are generous on the meat quantity. 

The meat selections are Rib, chicken, thin end, turkey leg, brisket, sausage and pull pork. We got the three meat combo. Although their price is the most expensive in along the I-275, but they make up the quantity of the meat. I got the brisket, sausage and rib. I think their rib is the best. I also like their brisket with good marinated BBQ sauce. I saw some one order the turkey leg sandwich, it was looking good. They will chop up the rib to bite size for easy handling. 

Overall my experience with them is great. Sometimes you need to wait for the meat because it is still in the smoker.

What's up Tampa Bay. Do you know there is new kid in the block that serve endless sushi. It has all the vibe to attract young and old. Definitely good for hungry teenager. 

This new sushi place has different signature rolls that are very good in my book. I would said this sushi place is the best in Tampa now for endless sushi. I can tell you there are several favorite sushi in my list. The Hawaiian roll is unique and gooooood. The salmon skin roll made the mouth watering. The spicy "white" tuna hand roll is definitely a try item. Don't forget BBQ Salmon hand roll. It is tasty. 

The interior designer design has automated color changing lights. They are beautiful to look at. You have a choice sit on the sushi bar or regular alcohol bar. These bars have fancy lighting system. The service is good. No slow down period.

#500 Review

I have been saving this review for some time. I chose Nico's Arepas Grill not just for the good food. It has successful Cinderella story that many small businesses can learn about it. 

Many yelper know about them for the food truck they have operated. The Arepa that they have served using the imported Venezuela cheese. This cheese is almost like mozzarella cheese. When it melt, you can pull like small string. Thousands yard long. May be not. May be you can make it to Guinness record by single pull cheese string. Good Luck:)

This is a small guy that make it to the big stage. Now they open the restaurant to serve this food. It is truest Cinderella story make it to the big stage. What make them successful is the first impact that make the customer want to comeback after one visit. The success reason are:
1. Nice restaurant interior design to attract young and old crowd
2. Great service that make you feel welcome
3. Vibrant atmosphere created by the people who work there feel the Latino warm feeling 
4. Good food for the reason to come back 

This was our second stop of restaurant night and we have ordered the Nico Sampler and Sopa de Res. In the sampler, every items are great especially the cachapas. The cachapas is made from sweet corn and they are good. The Sopa de Res is the beef soup and it is very good too. They told me the weekend special is their tripe soup and it usually sold out in the morning. 

Our waiter Rafael make our trip special and welcome. I am glad they hire the good personality and vibrant waiter. If you feel hungry at night when all restaurants have closed, they are the few open restaurant in the Bay Area. They open till 4 am in the week end. Go checkout and give them a shout if you like.

Rare Ethnic food 2 - African cuisine. If you heard about fufu, this place serve this items. It is a starch items that can be commonly found I Africa. This material is pound into flour. The texture is like dough. Very healthy. 

The first course we have is the coconut rice with assorted meat. We have the goat, beef and chicken. The meat is cooked in similar to curry paste but is not curry. The meat was cook for a long time and they separated from the bone. Good dish to have. 

Our second course is the Egusi Soup. It is a mix of ingredient that I not even know. But it is go well with the fufu. It also has a selection of meat of your choice. 

We added puff-puff and moin-moin. Puff- puffins a unique fried dough. Very puffy. The moin- moin is the puréed bean. It is lightly glaze on the outside.

What a experience. This is a 4.5 stars restaurant. Since my wife gave 4 stars, I can give 5 stars to make it 4.5 stars.

Definitely good fast food restaurant. In compare to many fast food, this restaurant is may be top of the list. Right their bowl is my top of the list for bowl under $10 list. I glad someone do it right. I hope they still keep the quality and quantity after one year. Then they are truly 5 stars. 

It is order on tablet at the entrance. You can add meat if you like. We got the pesto pasta with grilled chicken. It grilled and chop chicken. The pesto sauce is good and high class restaurant quality. We also got the forza bowl. It is power bowl has a lot of grain. We got the manzo. Most importantly is the cube steak. Medium well steak cook very well. The grain included roast corn, garbanzo, farro, veggies and more. I definitely recommend this bowl. Best value and best taste. 

The appetizers is Nutella Piatto. Is thin crush Nutella quesadilla. It is delicious. We like the crispy and the good test. Not much of service. Order is by tablet then they notified you with text message to your cell to be pickup at the counter. There is a curb side pickup.

This is a truly five star restaurant. They deserve to be Yelp top 100 list. I think they should be top10. The restaurant is small. If you come in weekend, please reserve before you go. We were doing the spontaneous restaurant hopping. We were lucky to have the last two seats of the restaurant. 

When you walk into the restaurant, you will feel the festival atmosphere of Octoberfest.  The accordion music make it nice and pleasant. He play the familiar tune. I wish the whole restaurant can hold hand like we are in Munich and sing along with the beer on one side. The waitress is very beautiful and very nice. Love the super service here. They are from Munich. 

This restaurant serves the Bavarian region food of Germany and very similar to the food that we have visit in Black Forrest of Germany.  We have the Veal Schnitzel with mushroom sauce. It is delicious!!!! It come with two side. We have the handmade noodle Spaetzle and the hot potato salad. The potato salad has some ham crump to go with it. Hmmmmmm. Are you hungry now? Go enjoy a dish a meal here. I also have the import beer - Paulaner Octoberfest. It is good beer.

I am glad that a just newly opened restaurant reopen for the take out. This restaurant open just before the pandemic. During the pandemic, I was not able to call them for they are open for take out because they not able to reach through the phone. Until recently they announced in Yelp they open for take out. 

Although we could not try their in store BBQ on the Korean BBQ, but one day we will be there. In the mean time, we appreciate they proceed with take out menu for us to try their food. We got the bulgogi and galbi plate. This dish come with white rice and four side dish. I like Korean side dish such as the tasty beans sprouts and the Korean fish cake. 

The Galbi has great marinated sauce. Well grilled, good meat quality, good enough quantity. The food is good for me to

It is a 5 stars performance. Price, taste, quantity, and quality is reach it perfect condition. I would recommend this restaurant to a friend. Thanks to Brigitte's review and notice this restaurant six months ago. Finally we have a chance to visit. Love it. 

I got a fruit juice in water. It was delicious to start. Today they have tripe soup with beef. It is cook till everything is soft. The spice was marinated into the tripe. Our main dish is Breaded steak with rice and fried cassava. The breaded coating has some seasoning spice. It the best Colombian breaded steak I have. It is big piece. 

Our next dish is Bandeja di Mi Tierra. It has skirt steak, chicharron, chorizo, sweet plantain, creole potatoes. This is big combination dish. It has great churrasco. The the steak is well seasoning. The chicharron is very crispy and is not tough to bite. I like this dish have a lot to offer. 

Server are very friendly. They also serve breakfast.

We know about this Japanese restaurant for long time. We did not make it there until now. I have seen friend celebrate her birthday there. Now I know why she choose this place. 

This restaurant seem like mom and pop shop and may be a generation restaurant. We were here for lunch. We start with 3 rolls combo sushi lunch special. This dish has volcano roll, California roll, and fried fish roll. All pieces is delicious. It come with great ginger salad. I like the ginger dressing. The second dish is the Tempura udon. The udon and Tempura are separated. Each one can be a meal by its own. The Tempura has the shrimp and fried veggies. The udon has a bit fried bit root in the soup. Make it good dipping sauce for the Tempura. This is my first order combination Tempura and udon in single one dish. Love it. 

Overall they are 4.5 stars in my book. Good service. Finish lunch less than 40 minutes. It is make for office hour limit.

If you have a dairy problem and love ice cream, you will love this place. It is dairy free ice cream place. It is also the vegan ice cream place. It is a mystery to see what in it and what kind of flavor they serve. We were here walk by and decided to explore. Love the concept with dairy free. I was wondering how it taste without dairy. 

We got the matcha latte and the divine chocolate. It proof itself without dairy ingredients, the taste still can be achieved. The matcha latte has good taste with coconut flakes in it. It is delicious. The divine chocolate has good chocolate taste with rich in flavor. Both scoop are delicious. No taste try. But definitely worth the ice cream in every flavor.

Great sandwiches shop at Wesley Chapel / Lutz area. It is hidden gem in this location. Very close to 4.75 stars. Definitely worth the try and return for more. The restaurant clerk is very friendly. They did give us try on their squeeze juice. 

We got the Serranito sandwich. This sandwich come with prosciutto ham on the egg. It also has grilled green pepper which is delicious. This almost like breakfast item but it is eye pleasing. We also got some item from seafood section. The Lobster on Cuban. I have Cuban sandwich before, but a lobster Cuban is the first time. The sandwich did pack with lobster. Then it is press like Cuban sandwich. Highly recommended. The sweet chili sauce accompanied well. 

Overall we like this place. It has seafood sandwich, pork, poultry, beef sandwich. Got to try them all. Kid menu also available. Try their fresh squeezed juice. Side item includes conch fritters, cod fritters, empanadas, stuffed potatoes ball are also delicious.

Grille One Nine may be the best happy hour sushi. They also has the $1,$2,$3 item during the happy hour before 7 pm. The sushi rice is better than three other sushi happy hour place I have been to. 

Tonight we have to pick up our car at dealer and pass by this place. I have seen Stacy visited this place before and book mark it for some time. We have ordered the spicy tuna roll, gator roll, Florida roll, and eel roll from the happy hour and order a surf and turf roll from the specialty menu. The gator roll is the is the yellowtail, tuna, atomic aioli, scallions, smelt, and tempura chip. This is a good roll. I also like their eel roll that serve a good eel. 

The specialty surf and turf roll is fried lobster top with seared steak. Mmmm I like this roll. We also added the nigiri smoke salmon and freshwater eel. The service is great. Please call ahead since many come to happy hours.

This an update from the previous take up to current dine in experience. There is no doubt eat at the shop is the best option. The food just prepared and they are good to go. I am considered they are top store for devil crab in tampa. 

We order one devil crab and they are huge. The whole ball is stuff with crab meat. They definitely worth for the money. It come with chip and drink. Do you know the breakfast special is only $5.99 and they give a lot. It includes sausage, ham, scrambled egg, and more. Big breakfast to share. 

After a true sit down visit, I feel they are one of the best in Tampa. It can be easily one of the most like in the bay. If you visit Tampa, this is one you should try. Sandwiches is famous here too but the devil crab is the jewel of the store.

Rare ethnic food # 64. Thai Street Food

This is noodle restaurant has a lot to boast about. It is first Thai street food in the Bay Area. Their menu concentrated on noodle with many different choices. It is a true 5 stars restaurant to my book. I once been to a street vendor in Singapore that received the Michelin Star. This restaurant will be our Tampa Bay Street Food That has Michelin star quality. 

We started with Namtok Moo. It is the grilled slice pork with Namtok sauce with roasted rice powder. The marinated was good. The slice beef is great. Our fist entree is the Ba Mee Moo Dang. It is the BBQ pork with egg noodle. It is a dry both noodle dish. Very similar to Malaysia dry wonton noodle dish except they use BBQ pork. I like the sauce at bottom of the dish. So you need to mixed before you eat will help the flavor. The second entree is the Tew Pad Toon. It is the duck noodle soup. The duck is deboned. The duck is cook in the broil herbal soup. The soup base also from that. I think this dish win my heart. 

We have a lot love for this restaurant. Although it is too far for me to visit but I will make the effort to revisit. I highly recommend this restaurant.

East Bistro offer stone oven food that is delicious. Under $10 you can filled you stomach with great food. This is small businesses we need to support. I think they are better alternatives than the fast food such as McDonald. 

I pass by here a lot but never go into the restaurant. This restaurant has some sit down place. This is almost like cafeteria order at the counter and pick up the food. However, they have good food. I have order to go. I have order the Kibbeh, beef kabab and atayef. The kibbeh is ground beef in cracked wheat shell. It is delicious. The kabab are the kofta with season ground beef and grilled over the open flame. It come with rice, baba Ghanoush and tabouleh. Mmmm good. I also have the dessert that is not in the menu. The Atayef-Arabic pancake stuff with walnut. They fried and dip in honey syrup before it serve. 

I gave 5 star for good pricing, good food, fresh ingredients, cook on the spot, and attentive service.

Gourmet or Craft bread. You decide. Either way, they have good bread. This bakery with the name 20 shekels is equal $5.06 USD. I believe the loaf of their bread more than 20 shekels ($7). 

We got a loaf of chocolate blackberry bread. They are delicious. It was interesting how they make it. They use sprouts dough. It is compact, jam, dense. Fill you up quick. 

Other item they have sold include sprouted brioche fruit tart, sprout lemon cake, sprouted banana muffin and many more. Come to check them out for fresh loaf. 

The store sale people are very friendly. They are knowledgeable to answer any questions. I would give them an "A" on the bakery item. Go enjoy yourself a loaf of bread. 20 shekels is very reasonable for the price of the loaf.

The line for dinner is 45 minutes wait. Fortunately they are only one block away from the Canal Street where we can wait and watch the parade. They will assign you a buzzer. And the buzzer range is about 1 block. 

This restaurant is recommended by our taxi driver. He has indicated the local love this place. Tonight we have order Crawfish étouffée and Seafood combo. The seafood combo is the fried shrimp, catfish and oyster. The coating is Louisiana bread coating with dry coat. The cat fish and the oyster is killer in this dish. The cat fish is fresh that do not smell fishy. The fish is soft and tender. The oyster in New Orleans is different and soft after fried. The chef did a very good job. Normal fried oyster is a bit rubbery but the chef here make it almost like raw oyster soft. 

The pre-meal items came with the broil potatoes. The potatoes are inch in diameter. They broiled and coated with spicy salt spice that I could not guess what spice. It is good. The crawfish came with salad with sweet vinaigrette dressing. A bit sweet for me but is good. 

The Crawfish étouffée is one of the New Orleans must try item other than Gumbo and Jambalaya. This is a gumbo soup base material with rice and crawfish. This crawfish is broil alive and the shell is removed. The crawfish then added to the soup base with rice. The dish has more than 30 crawfish tail. This is a good dish.

I was here to have a take out. I have this restaurant bookmark since my friends in yelp M&M has been here. The restaurant is well decorated with Bob Marley picture. They also has salt water fish tank. 

I got the their two best saler in the menu. The oxtail and the jerk chicken. The oxtail was well sauce marinated into the bone. The tail is braised till the meat fall off the bone. The jerk chicken is marinated till enter the meat. Then it grilled to perfection. When you use your finger to eat the chicken, you still can smell the marinated sauce at your finger after you have finished the chicken. Each dish come with rice, stir fry veggies. 

I also got their conch soup. It is a bit fishy but it is good. Love all the food here. Portion is big to feed the hungry person. Price is above the average Jamaican restaurant but the the portion measured up the price.

My revisit was the best. We have a chance to take a photo with the executive chef of the restaurant. We like to thanks Jessica Boyd for setting up our company holiday party here. Definitely have a good time here. Service was excellent. And thanks to Chad Bash to allow us enter the reserved room earlier before our set time. Their special room can can seat 50 people easily and good for smaller wedding party too. 

Tonight I try their different cocktail. Each one has their unique taste. My first one is the salted caramel martini, it is sweet with foam above. Second is the tall and sexy, definitely this tall glass attractive with beautiful waist look glass. If you are thirsty, this is the drink to go. The next is the Bourbon Barrel Aged Spice Sangria, this special make sangria which is great for accompanying the meat dish. The next is I believe scofflaw but not sure. The last is the Midnight Martini to wake me up with coffee drinks. It has good coffee in it. My friend enjoy the Black Widow and the Sacred Margarita. They even pull out a virgin Black Widow for a non alcohol soft drink. It was good for them. The margarita was the best among my friends because it come with fruit press for the drinks before pour. Unique. Some of my friends order the virgin pina colada and Daiquiri. They enjoy it. 

Overall the good are great love the appetizers and main dish.

We love our restaurant street at old height. This restaurant I have bookmark for some time. I love the creative chef went out their own and have their independent restaurant. This business owner did a good job for themselves. We were here on Friday night late after 8 pm. There were seats in this restaurant. The seating area is limited. Very nice clean bathroom. 

Tonight we order three small plate. The escargot, the sear blue fin tuna, and the mussel. The escargot is seat on the bread and pour in wine sauce. It make it perfect when they are soak. The escargot is in good size and they about 10 pieces. Sauce is about the right touch for the escargot. The mussel come with creamy sauce. It is a good dish to pickup not over power the material. 

I like the tuna the best. This a blue fin tuna in belly section. It is a bit fatter and rich in taste. They are likely seared top with a bit soy sauce with fragrant  taste and lay over a special chili sauce. 

The price for the small plate is good. The price of the large plate in about the medium to high side. Not much of seating area but good enough for the night.

Yelping #1300. This one go to the local restaurant that has very good potential. 

Ebisu is new and up coming Sushi restaurant. 8/5 will be their anniversary. They have special for the night. The celebration included live band, special dish, freebies and discount. 

We arrived one day before their anniversary. We got here a little after 5 pm. We were the second group of the day. This place is popular after we have sit down. Many have followed. The menu did not has an spectacular wording to attract you. We have order the early bird special. The special is classic roll buy one get one half off. We have order the spicy tuna, negihama yellow tail, unakyu eel cucumber, Mexican fried shrimp avocado. This roll are fresh and well prepared. 

We also order the Salmon Oyako Don - salmon sashimi with salmon roe and rice. The salmon was very fatty and good. We also got the special of the day, the fatty tuna sashimi. Wow. What a good piece of tuna. Very rich and nice. 

The reason they are true 5 stars is because their quality of the fish is top grade in compare to many Japanese restaurant. It definitely worth the money.

Yelping #1800. This go to the local restaurant has great interior. 

I was here for a solo dinner. I found a place at the bar with great atmosphere. Almost every spots are occupied. The bar has a nice decoration hanging on a T cross beam. I know the owner did not mean it to be sacred flowers on the cross but I think is perfect. 

I start with their signature cocktails. The black widow. It is a silver tequila, agave nectar, blackberry, lime juice and a leave of fresh basil. It do have enough alcohol for the tequila. The blackberry accompanied well. It is a good drink. 

The entree is the Hawaii Delmonico. It is angus ribeye marinated in the pineapple and sweet soy. It is Hawaiian thing. I ask the steak to be medium rare. I was hoping they glaze without over burn because it is sweet. The chef did a good job not just prepared to the order, it caramelized the entire steak. It is great to have it. 

My night is perfect. The bar service is very attentive. I like pre-meal item. The bread with chili bell oil sauce is well balanced. If you think about special occasions with manageable budget, this is a great place to celebrate your occasion.

Authentic Cuisine #60. Mexican dessert. 

This dessert store is one of the kind. I was surprised to bump into it when I shop at this plaza. It has minimum 50 different dessert items that you can choose. The make up of the dessert is eye pleasing. 

I started with cucumber soft drinks to quench my thirst. The cucumber water was fresh and nice. We got esquite as salty dessert. It is the corn and cheese. It is warm and nice. I got the strawberry Fresada. It has chili powder, strawberry slice, some kind Mexican candy. The drink has strawberry smoothie. It is typical interesting drink. 

We also got the popsicle. It has fresh food. Many choices of popsicle. They also has churros ice cream. They also carry tapas like shrimp cocktail in Mexican style. One thing for sure. Your experience here will be one of the kind. It is not like your typical dessert that you normally have.

We think we had been to La Pequena until a friend told me that it not their main restaurant. We actually went to the express. The one that have water mill at the front is the express.  The actual restaurant is actually on the right of the plaza in the same location. This time we get to the right main restaurant. The menu here is definitely different and plentiful to select. 

We have order the salmon special and their beef soup. The food portions are huge. Material is well prepared. Value is definitely there. The salmon is grilled and top with mango sauce. The accompanying sides are rice tostone and fried yucca. The fish is grilled to the way I like it. The beef soup is one of the best. This time we are asking the soup with grilled palomino steak. It has yucca and beef meat in tiny pieces. 

When we eat there the next door has salsa music. We saw a lot waiter in and out. We walk across the building door and found the dancing room is part of the restaurant. Very nice. Fern need to be here. Now you eat, drink and play in one place.

If need home cooking, this is your place. The restaurant chef prepare the meal from beginning. A lot of work. The dish that I have need a lot of time to prepare. I have the OX tail that was cook for long time to make it soft. It cook in the Caribbean spice and has a lot of Indian influence. The tail must be slow cook to make it separate from the bone. This dish accompanied with cabbage and the bean rice. You can have the choice of white rice. 

I also have the flower drink - Sorrel. They prepared it and put in the cup and store in their refrigerators. Sweet treat. They have some other food please check it out. They also have fried fish. You can call ahead to have your fish prepare before you arrive. It will take some time to fried. The owner of the restaurant is very friendly. I like about this mom and pop shop.

Great food and good price. This is very much sum up the entire review. It is easy to give this restaurant a good review. The new restaurant do bring a lot good to the neighborhood especially for blue collar workers. If you need a good box food, I recommend this is the place. For me, I prefer to eat there because they just prepare fresh. 

We started with the pork spring roll and chicken egg roll. These rolls are the complimentary from the restaurant. We added the charshu Bao. The spring and egg roll is freshly fried. Very good. The Bao has good steam bun. The price come with three Bao which has a lot of meat. Love the Bao and sauce on it. 

We got the bulgogi and grilled pork noodle bowl. The bulgogi is the best. The steak of the bulgogi is soft and tender. Good to bite. The grilled pork has good seasoning. It is a bit different then most Vietnamese food but I like this way. 

I like restaurants set the food in right price. This restaurant make it to the list. It is convenient to have the box during pandemic. If you cannot finished, you can carry it home.

The first Bubba in Florida. It is sister company of Texas Roadhouse. But I think they are better than Texas Roadhouse and is a improvement. The best thing is affordable cocktails. $4 not bad at all. I got the midnight train and the Frozen All American Margarita. The midnight train is ok. But the Frozen American is wonderful. Next time I will try Long Island ice tea. 

We have the Rib-Eye steak 12oz and Signature Ribeye Steak 14 oz. the regular ribeye just grilled but the signature is marinated. Both are really good because good quality meat. The signature ribeye is marinated in sweet sauce. It is excellent. We also good 12" pepperoni pizza and the raspberry chipotle wing. The pizza is ok but the wing is really good.  

The only thing that need improvement is the reception. It need some work. When the table is available, they need to hurry up shorten the wait line. It just too much for reception to take phone order and lead to table. The service for the table is really good. They have enough people to handle the food delivery and tablE service.

4.5 stars restaurant is correct. This restaurant has been here for sometime. It has great Venezuela cuisine. This restaurant also has great acoustic sound system for the music they play.  

The food here is in good portion. May be enough for second meal. We have the Parilla Mar Y Tierra (mix grilled) and Churrasco. The churrasco have the selection of two side. We have the bacon and chorizo. This side is big. The churrasco is also big size. The seasoning is good. I like my wife entrée better. She has the mix grilled. This is a value dish. You can try different marinated meat. 

They serve different juices. I have the lulo. The service is good. The restaurant is not too busy after 8 pm. But they close at 9 pm. They are well hidden in the corner of the plaza. If you travel southbound Dale Mabry, start looking for it after the village inn.

This Thai restaurant you may not know about it until you have traveled to Seminole, Florida. They hide away in the plaza corner. My experience with them is not yet 5 stars. It is about 4.5 stats. 

The restaurant has good Thai food. I was here with a friend. He got the dish not in the menu and not serve to the public. This dish is call Kapoon. It is noodle dish with intestinal, pig stomach, and many other ingredients. This is actually a Laos dish. You only have to be lucky enough to enjoy it. 

I got a dish from the menu. I have shrimp in garlic sauce. It is a good sauce. The shrimp come in 7 total quantity. They are large. The entire dish is only $11 for the dinner price. Not bad at all. I also got a dish to go. The drunken noodles with shrimp. Again, the chef has a very good wok technique. Burn on the edge and maintain the wok high BTU oil burn technique. Love it. 

My friend got the sticky rice with mango. This dish top with sesame seed and coconut milk. Look very good. I would give them the credit for good dish in reasonable price. Come and enjoy them.

This is 4.5 stars in my book. When I was first here for the next door restaurant and notice them. That time they still working on the building interior. Now seeing them doing well, it is encouraging business in Brandon. There will be wait if you are not there early. I was there on Sunday ahead the church crowd. There is already 20 minutes wait. We take the breakfast bar without wait. 

We have the Dakota - it is flat iron steak with bread, toast and a side. I got the grit. The steak is delicious with the right seasoning. Steak was cook well and compliment to the chef skill. We also got the churro waffle. This dish come with 4 quarter pieces waffle with whip cream and caramel syrup. The waffle is crispy. A bit oily but is tasty. Very unique dish. 

I saw many dish fly out the serving window. The quantity of the food and presentation of the food was really nice. Service is attentive. It is step of right direction for the new restaurant.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. This restaurant in my bookmark for a while. We finally make it here to try the restaurant. This restaurant is kind east meet west. They have Laos food, southeast Asian, Asian, Italian, Americans cuisine. I like the ideal of variety. 

My wife have the grilled chicken with pasta. The chicken is marinated in satay sauce. It is a interesting combination with the Italian pasta. The chicken is well marinated into the meat. Great flavors. 

My dish is the New Zealand Lamb chop with red wine mushroom sauce. It serve over asparagus fried rice. Another west meet east cuisine. The lamb chop is well cook and soft to bite. Mushroom sauce is nice to be add on. 

The service is perfect, waiter is well train. Know the customer need and respond quickly. We have great time here.

Authentic Cuisine No 66. Mexican cuisine. 

It you don't mind hole in the wall setting, this can be your place. This restaurant is driven by good pricing and authentic Mexican food. If you want Street food, this may be your place. The restaurant is located at gas station plaza. It has limited seating. The food is delicious.

We have the Birria Taco. It is overnight taco meat. Sound not attractive. But after the meat cook overnight, the marinated spice in it. Add the cheese, it is good to have. Very fulfilling. It come with a soup that I have never have before. I wonder what is that. Before the meal, they have the flautas chip with salsa. It is delicious. We also got the ceviche taco, buche and campacheno taco. The buche is pig stomach and the campacheno is the mixed of steak, chicken and pork taco. Very interesting. 

Service is ok. The Mangonadas is great. It is a interesting street food.

#600th review

I choose Thuy Cafe because it is a small business with cool food. I would said Pinellas Park area have too many good Vietnamese food. This is one of the unique noodles soup area. It is tiny not too many seats. But we were able to get a seat at the weekend after the Love of Tango. 

I try their Bun Rieu Cua - Crab Cake Noodle Soup. This noodle soup have white crab cake, fried crab cake. Very nice soup base. The accompanying veggie is very well decorated with arrangement. This is my first time to have this soup. I have empty the whole bowl. 

We also have other items such as the lemongrass grilled beef sandwich, wonton noodle soup, shrimp chip. By the way, they have 20 different sandwich to try. Some include vegetarian ham. Ham for vegetarians???!!!

Pinellas, you don't know you have pearl in your area. Please check them up.

Finally New Tampa has it own assembly chain open up. To me it is 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. They 4.5 stars due to their creativity of sauce. We have try their vinaigrette cilantros sauce and we like it. We also try their ginger citrus and coconut sweet potatoes sauce. I can said the sauce went through good R&D. 

A few thing they can improve are the BBQ chicken and steak. I feel their steak do not worth for the upgrade unless I can order the medium rare steak and chop up. Steak is over done. However I have to tip my hat to the teriyaki chicken and spicy tuna. Their Brussels sprouts, mushroom and broccoli are favorable to add on. The base I would recommend the forbidden rice, noodle and cauliflower rice. 

One other thing can improve on is to fill up the bowl. Don't let it 80% full.

This is memorable night from The International Culinary School at The Art Institute of Tampa. This dinner no doubt is one of the best in the Bay now. The cost is low, the food is great, and we even get Chef Treatment. Tonight dinner is one that closer to my heart. The restaurant or the institute is naming as Tutored Chef and they only serves dinner on Thursday and Friday night from 6 pm to 8 pm. Please call 813-393-5395 for reservation.

The menu has ten items to select. Each item not more than $6.95. You also can try their special combination of the ten items from the menu with three to five course meals. The three courses is $13.95, four courses is $15.95, and five courses is $17.95. This is a steal and price buzzer. They are currently serving the spring menu. The summer menu will be start at July. I would encourage the patron go to support them. However, if you want to get the best cooking skill, come after four to six week later when they are familiar with their menu. That is when the food is goooooood. The food and the tip are going to the school. You can tip extra with cash and mention it is for the people who serve you. It is good for the student who serves you. 

Tonight we have everything in the menu. The restaurant starts with crouton with herb dip and enhance flavor butter. Then follow by baked empanada with passion fruit and Cajun Spice for opening. We started with grilled asparagus in asparagus puree and bacon bit. This is a well presented dish and it is elegantly presented. The asparagus is well cook and go well with the Canadian type bacon. The second initial entrée is the Egg - it is soft broil fried egg serve over the Mushroom Ragout. When the egg is cut, the egg yolk is spilled over the mushroom. The mushroom is cook with wine sauce. When it mixed with the egg yolk, it has added the flavor. The egg is fried with crust and tasty to eat. The third initial dish is the soup du Jour. The soup is one of the student creations.
