Creamy soup is served with smoke bacon. 

The main dish starts with the lamb - Chilled Grilled Leg of Lamb serve over the Israeli Couscous. It also has the touch of the Chimichurri sauce that makes the grilled lamb more desirable. The second main dish is shrimp - The shrimp is cook with Tarragon Tomato Relish and Chive Oil. It serves over the risotto. The taste is like old bay seasoning for the Maryland Crab. It goes well with the risotto. The third main dish is pork - They are two type pork is served here. Braise Smoked Pork Shanks and Sautéed Pork Tenderloin.  These are two different type of preparation. And both are good. It also serves with Potato Gratin, Baby Carrot, and snow peas. It is a balance meal. The fourth main dish is the beef - Slice Grilled Beef is place on top of the crouton and place on top of sweet Onion Marmalade. The onion is sautéed to soft and good for the mixed with the beef.

We close the night with Blueberry financier on blueberry sorbet and blueberry compote. It is pretty muffin cake over blue berry ice cream and syrup. We also have the Chocolate Marquis top with Ice Cream and roasted pistachios. Chocolate is same as mousse. 

I was going to post this review for my 200 hundred reviews. But restaurant this good needs to be shared. I am thinking do a UYE on the end of July or begin of the august when the student chefs get familiar with the summer menu.

It is a cute restaurant serving lunch and breakfast. Parking can be challenging if there is studio sessions next door. Even at regular weekends, the parking is full. They do have outdoor seating area if you bring the pet. 

There is must try drink in restaurant. The horchata iced coffee is a must have. I like it for cooling summer hot day. We got two different flans. The salted caramel and the butterscotch flan. Both flans are delicious. We also got the Timba with guava dipping. The Timba is the fried cheese - Queso Blanco. This fried cheese and great to have. 

The restaurant have many sandwiches. We were here after lunch for dessert. Food ordering was easy.

Rare Ethnic Food 7

This is an annual get together Ramadan experience at a restaurant of choosing. This will be our second annual Ramadan buffet with the Yelp friends. Usually the buffet start at sundown which is 8:30 pm. Petra was choose for this year Ramadan buffet of the night. If the Yelper want to actually experience it just fast for one day and join the dinner buffet is more meaningful. 

Petra put out a good feast. Total cost with tip and tax is about $20. It includes the drink, the buffet and the desserts. Yummy. Tonight we have the Lamb, grill chicken, fried fish, pita, three type of hummus, falafel, grape leave, lentil soup, Greek salad, and more. The lamb display is awesome. Feel like eating a horse, this will be the feast. The desert is great. Plenty to go around.

In this holy month, many has come to enjoy the buffet. The food is very good and a lot of choices. The drink include mint lemonade that very unique. I would join their buffet before is over. The feast is 4.5 stars.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. This is the third revolution ice cream I been to. This one have a lot of space. They always carry good ice cream. Sometimes I think they are too creative on the name that I could not figure out what is the really the ice cream flavor. 

Today I have the porky and the banana pudding. The porky is the vanilla ice cream with bacon. The ice cream is great. The bacon is good. The banana pudding is the one I like among the two. 

They do have taste try. My wife always ask me why you buy the one that I did not try. I said to her I already try all other flavor definitely buy the one I did not try.

I like the new concept of this place. This is a place I going to revisit. This first pick your own ingredients pizza place. It is build your own. First choose the dough. You can have white, wheat, gluten free or Keto friendly crust. I am going for the wheat dough. The guy who made it very skill. He stretched and throws to the air spinning with further stretching to thin crust. It is a show. 

Then you chose your sauce. You don't need to choose one sauce. I got the extra virgin olive oil then ask them to add the basil pesto. This is the first time I see pizza using basil pesto sauce. Unique. Next step is type of cheese. I am going to mozzarellas. Then the veggies, I pick the mushroom, sundry tomatoes, minced garlic, basil leaves, jalapeño and olive. First time also I see pizza add garlic. Then the meat. I got the sausage, pepperoni, meat ball, salami. That complete my master piece. 

I also ask them to top with balsamic drizzle. Love it. I don't eat a lot of pizza. But I would recommend this pizza. You can add the combo with drink and chip of gelato or salad.

The remote restaurant is rest at the middle of the rural area. Who can think this place is good and affordable in price. We were attract to the recent post in the talk by Nick S. for the highly decorate 5 star restaurant. We have to check this out tonight. The whole street is dark at that area except this restaurant. People line out at this place before their turn to order. The store front is small and we have a suspicious this is good?

The restaurant look like a hipster place. The setup is efficient  allow the patron to order and they give you a code to pick up the food. The sitting area is limited. They have some table at the outside of the building. Today we have the Austinite taco, west coast taco, and the Texas flood taco. This is translated as Carne Asada Beef, grilled shrimp, and beef brisket. All meat is grilled to perfection. The Austinite came with caramelized onion and avocado. The Texas Flood has the chipotle BBQ sauce. The meat is grilled and have a lot flavor. The beef and shrimp is marinated. 

All taco is $4.25, the burrito is $9.50, wet buritto is $10.25 and bowl is $9.25. You can order each combination at above package. The salsa of the chip is great. This place is affordable for the price, good quality food, perfect seasoning and flavor. As a result I have give them 5 star for the so little price we pay. The biggest price is to pay the gas to get there.

This food truck was at my eye sight for some time. I drove pass it for many time at that location and saw bright light next to the gas station. I have been here one late night but they close. Today was the perfect day to try. 

I would say they are the best taco in USF area. It is number two best in my list. We have order the lengua, tripa, asada, al pastor. I love the lengua and tripa. They are good flavor. The steak (Asada) was well seasoning, I like their way burn the steak a bit to bring out the aroma of the steak. The pastor has deep seasoning. Most of the taco place only lightly seasoning not bring out the good of the taco. Here did a good job. 

On my next return, I will surely try the Cabeza, chorizo, chicharon, and carnitas. Food is reasonable price. You can call the number to place your order ahead and pickup without waiting. They are fluent in English. Since it is affordable, I am not paid your taco.

For weekday lunch. The selection is great. You also can make your own pasta. Choose the pasta type, choose the protein, and choose the sauce. I can said that they have great chef technique. It won't be able to go wrong. 

The lunch special is less than half of the dinner price. It great for the business people have lunch here with quick order and get out in 40 minutes. Food is extremely good. You are paid more than value, great food and great flavor. 

We have chef Complimentary tomato sauce over toasted bread. Our entree are Grouper Rosso and Prosciutto Linguine. Both dishes are excellent. The Grouper Rosso grouper is blackened over fettuccine. The fettuccine is serve on creamy basil tomato sauce. It includes the mushroom and scallions. Great combination. 

The best dish is the Prosciutto Linguine. The Prosciutto and the fried garlic make great combination. The Prosciutto release the cure meat flavor into the dish make this dish desirable. Lovely dish.

Review # 2700, this review milestone go to Local Italian Restaurant to recognize their new efforts during pandemic. 

The restaurant take over previous Italian restaurant which has been here for some time. The new owner creates the attractive menu. What you need to ask is their special. They do have separate chef special seafood items of the night other than the menu. I also like the bigger dining room with compare to old restaurants. The ventilation also improved from old setup. 

We start the night with the fried calamari. The coating has a special flavor with seasoning. The dipping marinara sauce is fresh and different. I love it. Ingredients must be good condition to have the good sauce. 

My wife have the chicken parmigiana with spaghettini with pink sauce. The chicken is breaded with marinated coating. It was crispy and tasty with cheese and marinara sauce. The pink sauce also interesting. My dish is a signature of the restaurant. I have the sacchettini with added grilled shrimp. This is the first time I try sacchettini. It is dumping stuff with pear and mozzarella. Then it cook in Gorgonzola Sauce. It is heavenly good. Highly recommend this dish if you have never have this Italian dish before. 

Overall the service and food is good. A VERY excellent Italian Restaurant. Please ask if you can bring your own wine.

Rene is one of the great food truck in Tampa. For the Taco Truck, they are at top of my list. Great food and creative. Now they are located next to across Southern brewery empty lot area. You may want to call ahead before your visit to see if they open. They were at Dale Mabry before. The current location is more permanent. 

We have three different taco to try. We have the Chile Relleno, Carne Asada, Pork Barbacoa. The one taco that very interesting and recommended is the Chile Relleno. This jalapeño stuffed ground beef and fried. This is the first time I have taco this way. The carne Asada was delicious compared to many steak taco.

Overall the taco are excellent. Flavor is definitely good. They also have other type like grilled butter squash, pork belly, steak bacon, spicy shrimp and oyster mushroom. These menu is great and think out of box.

Excellent service, food and good atmosphere. This Noble Crust was strategic located in Carrollwood area. The selection of the plaza for this restaurant is perfect. In this plaza, they are the only restaurant. Which mean perfect for parking spot since no other restaurant compete for car parking during the night. I can easily find a space to park in compare to many other restaurant which I have circular the area for parking. 

The place in trendy. I like the modern decoration. 

Service: the waitress know how to compliment the dress or shoes of the customers make lady customers feel they did the right thing. This added pleasures does go a long way. 

QC: I have observed the kitchen head chef QC every dish come out. This make the consistency of the food. I would said that is a big step to make sure the food come out correctly. 

Kitchen: the new Noble Crust does have full equip big kitchen. It make all the food fly out without too much to wait. This is the reason why they are successful in this location. 

Food: we have the bistro steak, FGBLT, and the PEI mussel. The steak is cook to the temperature we have asked. It is good size of steak. It top over collars green with southern twist. The accompanying mash potato top with drizzle balsamic vinegar and green aioli. I like the steak top with green apple chimichuri. Very unique. The FGBLT is lay the fried green tomato as a base and layer with pimento cheese. Final touch top with glazed pork belly. The presentation is very nice. However the pork belly harmony is not there. I would said they need to work on the skin fat and meat combination. It need to be melt at your tongue instead a very chewy piece. I like the PEI mussel. It is cook with saffron broth. Most of the mussel I have either butter wine sauce or tomato red sauce. I like the way they have it with the southern twist with added andouille sausage. 

Overall, they are very good job with competitive price. It make me to revisit. Truly 5 stars restaurant with the right price. Not perfect. But close enough.

I like the different style of food is being served in Tampa. This fruit juice bar is one of the kind. It is part of Columbian daily street fruit juice. There two Columbia Mango I know off. This is one of them. I like this one better because they able to customize the drinks and fruit you want. In compare to boba drinks, this mango mix fruit juice combo is more naturally done. It is healthy. 

I got mango mixed and custom myself. I have mango noodle, mango leche, condensed milk and ice cream. Very nice. I ask them to prepare in the sweeten side. You can ask for sour drinks. The mango leche is from green mango frozen into drinks. Very refreshing. I also ask them pick the sweet mango which is great combo. 

The service is great here. The people who do mixer are very friendly. I will be back to experience their other fruit combo.

It is actually 4.5 stars rating. Since no half stars round up to 5. Shave ice with flavor is originated from Taiwan. I like the store did create some new and it is their own way. The shaved ice is smooth with nice design. Love the interior with dine in partition separation. 

We start with charcoal waffle with two choices of topping. I like this one to try. The charcoal waffle is unique. Our topping is the ice cream and the egg pudding. It is item to share. We also got the Lilac Lily shaved ice. The choices we have is taro flavor shaved ice. This item come with the chewy boba, grass jelly, red bean, gram crackers, condensed milk. It is sweet with sweet. The quantity is good to share. 

Overall our experience is great. Shave ice have good combination. Love the waffle.

Umu is 4.5 stars restaurant in my book. Not yet 5 stars. Their food is good enough to attract more customers to repeat. The decoration is contemporary with dining and sushi bar seating arrangement. I usually go for the sushi bar because I like to see what they made for sushi. 

This restaurant did serve omakase and Umukase. The omakase is $75. Six courses. The umukase is unlimited until you say stop. These two need reservations for the chef to prepare the and obtain the ingredients. 

I got the lunch special since I am in the neighborhood. I got the salmon misoyaki. This is Bento box with salmon prepare in miso topping. Salmon was cook to caramelize outwardly. I like the side. The stir fry veggies with slightly burn outside. They also goyaza in ponzu sauce. It also come with two pieces of sweet tamago. Great box for lunch. 

The lunch special has two roll for $10. It is good. I got the spider and yellowtail scallions roll. I like they prepare the soft shell crab has a lot of crab meat. Services is good.

Haven has been in my bookmark for sometime. Most of my friends been here has good time here. Mainly wine and cheese. But the happy hour is the most attractive. They have two parking area. If not street parking nearby is good too. 

The happy hour has great deal. People come early during this time to enjoy couple of wine or cocktails. The line is already build at entrance to be open during Friday night. Happy hour is for bar, lounge, and outside. 

We started with the Duck Confit Taco. The skins is different for the taco. Good enough. The second dish is the chargrills oyster. I like this dish. Somehow the oil in the oyster make this dish taste very good. The third dish is the grilled Shishito Pepper. With a bit sea salt oil and grilled over open flame is great for the wine and cocktails. Our board dish is charcuterie board with different ham. This is perfect dish with the slide cure ham. Our last dish is the chorizo fritter. Great ball fried with chorizo inside. 

Service is great at the bar. The server is very alert. I have cocktails. Both cocktails is welcoming.

If you want something prepared when you just order, this is the place. Many ingredients is original. Food are cook fresh on the spot. This restaurant is about 4.5 stars not yet 5 stars. 

This is a cute German restaurant. I like the decoration. You will notice the front is German like different from all other store front. We got the schnitzel. Since we did the progressive lunch. We only order this dish. For the price you paid, it is will worth the food. It come with two pieces of schnitzel. Top with mushroom sauce on top. The crust coating was crispy. I think mAy need a seasoning coating. Other than that. They are good. 

The service is excellent. You got the up close personal service. They also serve the German beer to wash the food down. It is good restaurant to try.

Somehow Lutz area has a lot of good BBQ. Recently station house has move to this plaza. It attracts a lot of local including us. Their store front is not ready yet but soon. I would said so many BBQ place and this one is top of my list in this area. A true 5 star. Wait until they fully open, they will be more famous. So far, they only serve take out. 

They have three giant smoker. It is impressive. The converted old fire truck to one of the Mobile smoke house. You got to try their smoke rib and chicken. The smoke taste deep into the meat. The marinated of the rib has some fruity taste. Very good fall off the bone. Easy to eat. Must be cook for long time. I hope they maintain this quality. The chicken is juicy and nice. The best part are their creative sides. Their cowboys potatoes salad or cole slaw is very interesting. They are not your typical normal side. They have good mixed and taste.

Great restaurant in St. Louis. If you looking for local dry rub BBQ, this is the place. It is located at famous St. Louis The Loop neighborhood. Very close to Washington University. 

The restaurant labeled themselves as Bourbon, Beer and BBQ. Definitely try the bourbon and BBQ. They have many selection on bourbon. I went for the local favorite. The Bird Dog. Great sense of smell. 

For the BBQ. We have the Bestie Combo. It allows to choose 4 different meat. We got the rib, brisket, wings and pull pork. The rib is half slab. Dry rub seasoning with meat fall off the bone. The wing is the best. Don't misses it. Great slow smoke wings. Brisket and pull pork also well receipted. The combo come with two side and a mushroom shape bread call cheddar popover. Very interesting. 

Our time here was great. Pricing is definitely better than Tampa. It is must visit restaurant.

It is 4.5 stars in my book. The take out and bowl are good. There is not much market for what I see. They do have some items for sell but to classify as market is bit stretch. I do like their cook food. It was delicious. 

I have miso salmon bowl and my wife have the Crispy Tori Katsu bowl. The miso salmon has large piece of grilled salmon. The technique for Grill was good. I like the edge with concentrate sauce. The miso is the sauce. This dish come with crispy Brussels sprouts, sweet potatoes and broccoli. The dish is well balanced. The crispy chicken katsu is coated with breading. It come with roasted carrots, sweet potatoes and broccoli. It serve with their house bull sauce. 

Overall the taste is there, price is right for the bowl. Many people have take out. I would try their bull bowl next time with beef tip. Food was well prepared.

Rare Ethnic Food #53. Haitian cuisine. 

I was hesitating about come here because the mixed reviews. After visited the restaurant, I found out the reason why. 50% of the food is fried here, it will be not great to have the take out. Eat there is the key. Because when you brought the food home, these food turn tougher. Especially the pork. 

We started out appetizers as Salty Fish Pate. The pastry skin is very flaky and the salty fish is great. Our next appetizer is the Akra. This is malanga fritter with great coating with nice seasoning. Malanga is root veggies. It is interesting to be fried with coating. 

We order the griot. It similar to chicharon in Spanish food. But the pork is seasoning before fried. Better than chicharon. It come with rice and bean and tostone. It also serve with spicy coleslaw and spicy red curry. This dish really need to be eat there. If not, the pork skin will be to tough to bite after you order to go and eat at home. You need to experience the crispy of just fried pork. 

I also got the Tassot Kabrit. It is marinated fried goat. The bone in chop meat is delicious and soft. It was not tough. May be just fry or the chef have good technique. 

Overall we like our food. A lot people order take out. Tip don't wear good clothes. Because you smell like fried food after eating. They need to improve the ventilation system.

4.5 stars is about right for this restaurant. I would have client power lunch or dinner here. It is because of the beautiful interior decoration. Great blinds curtains. Many crystal chandelier hang from ceilings. That is the reason they call this place Crystal Dining Room. 

One thing is they lack of service people die to lack of customer. However, food is good in compare to many place and the price is good for the food and ambience. I would host the wedding reception here. 

We have the New York Strip au Poivre. The steak is big enough and the sauce is great. The accompanying potatoes and asparagus was great. We also has the grilled salmon bed with rice, top with mango salsa. All the dish is great. The chef has great skill. All entree come with salad. I also like their dark n stormy cocktails.

I have been this place twice and we are enjoying every bit of it. I believe we found our Italian Ice in the county. I am not Italiano but love this place. Eat while you can before the weather turn too cold. 

Jeremiah's Italian Ice has many varieties. Their trademark ice is scoop froggy frog. However I like the mango and sea salt caramel. Like other Italian ice place in some Tampa a layer Italian ice with a layer of soft serve. Jeremiah can pile 4 layers which a layer more than anyone can pile in Tampa. I have try that route. 

I also have them do the ice only. The ice girl pile 4 layer and top one scoop of four favorite on top of four layer you have ask. It look colorful. The trick is to eat eat fast since they don't have soft serve in between. If it melt, the ice will mix together. But I like this way even freezing my brain. I have a few of them when I try this way. Take boon challenge!!!!!

South Tampa is lucky to has such store. This place is too far for me. But my visit is a pleasant one. I would consider a people care serving grocery store. 

The store offer craft beer sale, fresh produce, meat market, can goods and more. This store hold it own with very competitive pricing. 

The love of the store is not about the groceries. It is about the deli section. The have all kind of sandwiches to select include the one I like now grilled sea bass sandwich. It is only $6.99 for regular size sandwich. Compare to the seafood restaurant next door, I pick the value, good food anytime in this store. Other sandwiches include Cuban, gyro, Italian, ropa veja and more. Come to check them out. 

The have the hot deli in Cuban cuisine series. It include the roast pork and devil crab. Food here is good and convenient to housewife. I would visit them again if I am here.

This is about 4.5 star restaurant. We know about this type of cooking when we visited Taiwan 2005. The use of volcanic rock stone heat up over 700 degree and grilled the food is a healthy way of cooking. In Taiwan, the meat is marinated and cook over the stone. It is not much of difference than this restaurant. 

The lunch of the restaurant offer a better deal in smaller portions for experience if you don't want to spend too much money. For $12 you can have the sirloin, shrimp or ahi Tuna with a side during lunch. Recently they run the special for $18include steak and shrimp. 

They have butter on the side if you want to grilled your meat with it. This type of cooking requires fresh seafood of premium grade of steak. It is not recommend for pork or chicken. 

The food is tasty. It may require some minimum cooking skill to enjoy it. So who can blame if the food did not cook well. It was great to see the method is introduced in US. The dinner item is medium range in price compare to any steak restaurant.

Love it. Just outside of the food court at open area. Very visible if walk into the mall through the restaurant street and they located on the right hand side before the entrance. 

We have the Mr. Mango Favorite Frappe. The is peel mango noodle, frozen mango juice, fresh mango chop and condensed milk. She started the condensed milk spread around the wall of the cup. Chop mango then add condensed milk. Add frozen mango juice then top with mango noodle and condensed milk. It is epic. Go get yourself one of that. You can add spicy spread if you like. 

They do have Diablo Frappe it is street Mexican mango chop. Very spicy. May be try it next time.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not 5 stars yet. Thanks to Rachel local yelper who is the pioneer to visit this store. After a year, the business is still doing well. There were a lot of customers while we visited this place. 

I would suggest to go for the big Kahuna if you are hungry. It give you two proteins. I got the spicy tuna and large shrimp. The shrimp size is big also the spicy tuna is good size. We are happy the quantity they allow to add on. There are plenty selection. I got the masago, seaweed salad, fried corn and more. The add on is great. The base selection also a lot. I got the white rice and soba noodle. 

One thing that can be improved is the their rice. Instead of white rice, sushi rice is better. It has more flavor when preparing correctly. Other than the add on, they also have large variety of sauce for selection. If you don't like to mixed your on bowl, you can get the premixed bowl.

This restaurant located at Riverview. It is a popular restaurant in the area. Lunch has many customers is a good sign. I would said this is 4.5 stars restaurant in my book not yet 5 stars. I round up the stars because they have the Jackfruit Smoothie that not many restaurant carry it. The smoothie is nice dessert. 

I got the pork chop, shred pork, meat cake and fried egg and rice. Seem like this is a popular dish that many has order. The combo of this dish is twelve dollars but it has everything thing I need. Pork chop is delicious. Meat cake is a fan. I also has the shrimp fresh roll. The roll is big can be share and come in to two. 

Service is good and attentive. If I am visiting again, I would try their chef special. Ban Bun Hue. It is tapioca noodle.

This ice cream shop is truly like by many. The stars will tell you so. It is not easy to find. But the local know where it located. You have go to the back of the plaza and wonder you are at the wrong place, but just right there, you found the ice cream shop. 

They have many homemade ice cream. The flavor can be learn by many ice cream shop. I try all four flavors, and I like them all. I settled for two flavors. One is the loopy. It is with fruit loop and vodka fruit loop. You have to be 21 years old to try it. The other is the coconut blueberry. Both of them has wonderful taste. 

My wife has chocolate bacon toffee. It sprinkled with candy bacon. BACON. Definitely people love the most in their food. It is gluten free also. The clerk is helpful and has knowledge about the ice cream flavor. This will help customers to make the decision.

70 years history, it is not easy. This tell the story of this restaurant. It is definitely one of the best in Bay Area. After 70 years. It is definitely will do certain dish very best to serve the Tampa Bay. This is 4.5 stars restaurant to my book. 

If you come here for the seafood, I would recommend a dish. Scrod Jason. This is special dish that they do well. Celebrating 35 years dish. This is a whitefish, top with wine, cheese, garlic, and bread crumbs. The topping is so special, flavorful, crispy, enjoyable. Such a good topping. 

If you come here, you will notice most of the customers are white hair. It does have a grab for this group of people with older age. The service is great and attentive. It speak louder when the food is right.

I am glad that we have a Italian market near me at Wesley Chapel. The market do bring a lot business. Especially during the pandemic, a lot people cook at home. The Italian market provides convenient with ready to cook food, ready to heat food, or cook food for your table. This market is not tru 5 stars. But I really want them to survive, I rounded to 5 stars. 

The sandwich list is extensive. The have specialty's, cold or hot sandwiches. The sandwich is big. You are basically can buy the sandwich and eat at their outdoor patio. We got the bomb and Moschella special Italian sandwich. The moschella special is different cure meat and veggies. I like the way they assembled it. The bomb is very close to the philly cheese steak sandwich. It has pickles veggies. 

The ready to heat food including slice pork lion, crab cake grilled chicken, Wagyu steak and more. We like the crab cake. The Wagyu steak also good and tender. We got Marsala chickenpox heat at home too. 

Overall the market have a lot to offer. There are many other sections we did not explore yet. But we will be back.

This restaurant don't even need to show the name at the restaurant location. The only sign on the front of the restaurant is PUB. You cannot imagine that was enough to attract a lot customers. The secret is the food was awesome and creative. Usually pub has less women customers. But this pub mostly women. That tell the food here is the main reason. 

If you come here I recommend you to look at the chalk board outside before you enter. These are the chef special. They change so often. These items are the best. We have the three pig piggy. It is sandwich either three different way of pork. Grilled pork belly, fried pork, and ham. It was delicious. The fried coated pork is crispy. The side of potatoes tots also crispy. 

Our second dish is the duck flatbread. It is another creative item. Who thought the grilled duck breast over the flatbread with mozzarella cheese and arugula. I like this dish. Only these season. It may not be next time. 

It was great to open my 2400 series review with these pub that many people love. My wife usually don't like pub and this is an exception.

Today soft opening with everything 50% off. The drink is ready to serve. But not all the drink. The dessert also not ready yet. They still in job training for speed and operation. The store clerk fluent in English and Chinese language. 

So far so good with drinks. We got the super fruit tea and the mango mango Pomelo slush. The have slush if you ask. The two items we have is the most complicated. Need time to prepare. I would said they about 4.5 star. We have Moge tea in Orlando Dr. Philip before. We don't like that location tea. But the Moge here did a good job. Even this is soft opening, the flavor, presentation and balanced of taste is there. That is the reason they have high praise. 

My next visit may be tonight while run special. I would go with Creme brûlée milk tea. The mango pamelo slush was well done with cheese in the middle. It make easy to mixed. Love. I would recommend the mango pomelo.

Authentic Ethnic Food No. 48 Thai Cuisine.

Thai Mama is an excellent food truck who serve very good Thai street food. I like they move their food truck to the new location and look cleaner. It is better access rather middle of no way from previous location. 

The food is ver good and very street vendor like food. We got the steam pork dumplings, as an appetizer which is good. The dish I like the most is the drunken noodles. This dish you actually need them to make it spicy level they like to eat. Because the call drunken in spicy chili. The other dish I like is Pad See Ew. This dish they cook dark soy sauce. But I like they way they prepared the veggies in the noodle. 

We have ventured to try their Panang Curry. It is coconut milk curry and it is very good. The other dish we try is their special glass noodle with pork. I am said this is average dish. 

Since this is food truck, you can call earlier for your order. They are out door dining so wear proper cloth for the weather that day.

This is one of the kind breakfast place. We like the restaurant because is local flavor. The outside seating is good but if someone smokes, may be inside is better. The host is very friendly. We were able to tell we don't like the seat beginning. 

Make sure you ask for the daily special. It is always interesting. We have the country fried steak and chocolate pecan French toast. These are the special of the day. The country fried steak top with meat gravy. It also come with hash browns and two eggs. It also has mable toast. The French toast topping is very special with chocolate pecan overlay. Good sweet breakfast to begin the day. 

Service is good. I believe they are very good on their food for breakfast and lunch. Coffee is great.

Review # 2800. Rare Authentic Dessert - 68. This one go to local dessert store service Middle East food. 

We were attracted by their Turkish Delight. We first know about this dessert from Narnia movie The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe when they tasted this dessert. The Turkish delight is amazing. Not too sweet but have good chewy and flavorful with or without nut. Not only the dessert is imported, they delicious and fresh. 

We have several dessert. They cost is by weight. We got 1.25 pounds of dessert. It includes the hazel nut and cream, chocolate expresso, banana, and more. I love those strength looking dessert. All of them is delicious. The also has the dessert cookie with pistachio that I experienced in Jordan. They also carry different types of nuts. The chocolate selection also good from Europe.

Food is 5 stars. No doubt. 

The restaurant just have the soft open. I would said give them a few week to familiar with the serving routine. It is still a chaos now. Beautiful interior design as a desirable to sit down and enjoy. Service is still need to improve. 

You know if a restaurant will make it or not by just tasting the food. This is the restaurant I will repeat in the future. Food is very reasonable price and easy to select - may be not - it has huge selection. I love it. It make me to come back for more. They have good food presentation. Nicely decorated. Fast food chain of America, watch out, I can eat better food here. 

We start with our entrees with Thinh An Special Noodle Soup and the Hue Style Beef Noodle Soup. I like the Thinh An Noodle. It has the clear noodle soup with seafood in it. Very good soup. My wife have spicy hue style beef noodle. Good but I like the special better. Then we move to the grille pork summer roll -  the appetizer. It is good. 

Our desert is what I search for some time. Hong Kong Waffle. They call it egg puff waffle. The waffle is puffy and crispy. Right baking. It come with two scoop of ice cream and two topping. I have the mango and coconut ice cream with assorted mochi and the blue berry mochi. Delicious. 

Advice for the new comer. Come early at dinner before they are busy, get all the order in earlier. For the owner, I think open late and closing late is better. Breakfast usually don't get much sale. Usually people get one item and leave. Dinner people tendency to order more and get more sale. I will update on next visit.

No. 400th review. This is a UYE worthy restaurant. You know it is a good restaurant when you take the first bite. This is actually rediscovered restaurant when my wife have a conversation which restaurant has pierogi polish food. 

The restaurant is part serving food restaurant and part grocery store. We follow the recommendations of friend review to order the Two for Thirty dish. This dish come with every combination with sampler of the restaurant menu.  It includes the pierogi, staff cabbage roll, grill pork kielbasa, potato pancake, pork schnitzel, two soups and desserts. It is very good value.  The pork schnitzel is deep fried and top with sauce. That sauce has fragrant smell and I am impressed by the cooking.  

The soup we have are Borsh and the tripe soup. The Borsh in the red beet broth with small pierogi. The tripe soup is pressure cook and soften. They are delicious for the soup.  The dessert we have are the coconut banana cake and the poppy seed cake. Both of the desserts are super good.  And we have left over to take home.

The classic historic building where Bernini Italian Restaurant display some the historic value of the YBOR. We set this night to check it out first time. The interior dinning hall is a beautiful setting with two story high ceiling make the open space very pleasant. They also have the up stair siting which increase the capacity of the restaurant. They have bar with TV for the single dinner or people who wait for the table. Atmosphere is great.

We have started with the Beef Carpaccio. The thin slice of the beef to be pick up and set on the white truffle and a touch of balsamic vinegar. This is delicious. Our entrée are Blacken Atlantic Salmon and Crispy Duck. The salmon serves with spinach and zucchini. I like the lemon butter sauce that accompany the vege. the salmon grill with blacken at top of the salmon that make the taste desirable. Some improvement can be made on how to prepare the blacken side. Like the beef can be cooked for well-medium-rare, the blacken also can be prepared lite spicy-medium-black spicy. This can give the customer a choice of their familiar taste. The crispy duck is definite the go to dish. The duck is debone to only three bone left -wing, two leg bone. This make the dinner easy to consume. The dish serves with mash potato and the duck top with the gravy. The skin is very crispy that make the name of the dish. The duck meat is great and softly prepare. I have try crispy duck with orange sweet sauce, five spice crispy duck, pekin duck. But duck with gravy is first time. We end our evening with champagne raspberry sorbetto. The sorbet is great. By pulling the champagne on top of the sorbet that create the bubble sensation of the taste. The dinner end with creative dessert is making the dinning perfect.

Today we came before 7 PM and they have the entrée for the half price. It is a steal. Even after 7 PM, they are also good due to the amount of the food was given. The quality and quantity surely make the chart. The service is perfect for the night. Certainly will be back. They deserve the five star rating for tonight. The half pricing make it to the top.

This may be the best Carrabba's chain restaurant in the Tampa Bay Area. There are number reasons they are good. The skill chef, attentive serving staff, wide seating area with good decorations. 

I have here for event and also come here to eat in person. I like their chef because they paid attention to the detail for the food. We started with the mussel in white wine butter sauce. The mussels was clean and not have any sand particle. The chef has good skill to cook this dish that the mussel meat just tender and soft. I have seen many chef has over cook the mussel but the here is very good touch. 

The entrée are 6 oz sirloin and the shrimp and scallops linguine alla vodka. This sirloin was well prepared to the temperature I have ordered. The seafood linguine was well prepared. I like the large shrimp and large sea scallops. Good selection on the material. The dish make excellent mark.

This newly open restaurant was posted a drink from my friend which very attractive. I decided to visit it within a week from her post. The restaurant has a stage for the musicians. It has music entertainment, bar and food. Please check on their Facebook page for show schedule. Some day includes salsa and swing dancing if you want shake off you hip. 

The food we order have some Peruvian and some Columbian cuisine. We started with Leche de Tigre - raw fish and cook shrimp in lime juice. The raw fish is in bit and small pieces. I will prefer it to be dice. Or slice. Shrimp is cocktail size. 

Our entrée are Bandeja Paisa Colombiana. This dish has many items. It includes grilled steak, fried Pork Belly, sausage, fried egg, rice, fried beam, fried sweet plantain. It is parade of food. Great taste for each items. Our second dish is Pescado A Lo Macho - fried filet fish as a base and with sautéed shrimp, octopus, squid, and mussel in seafood broth tomato base sauce. I like the sophisticated cooking. It make it interesting. 

They have army of wait staff. Easy to get attention. Their staff can speak clear English which make easy to order. Food is good, service is good, great experience.

Finally St. Pete has a good enough poke. I like Chai Mixology has serve poke, wings, and boba tea. It is cute store at central avenue. 

They serve poke that you can do your own or you can get one that pre set for you. We go for their best seller pre set - Mixology Poke. This is salmon and Tuna as protein. Including the seaweed and ginger. I like they add extra sauce on the side if you needed. Also extra salsa. The fish is firm and the piece was cut big. They were generous on the protein to create happy customers. Good strategy. Now day we have so many poke place open. This will be good sign for better and more protein. 

The store clerk was very friendly. Definitely will visit them on next time I am in the neighborhood. Enough poke to fill the stomach. I will try their boba next time.

I am having easy day off. As a result, we chose a restaurant with lunch special during weekdays only. This restaurant has been in the Bay Area for a year and I saw Anna M. has carry out from this sushi restaurant to watch the movie at home. We decided to try her cinema sushi bite. 

This is actually mixed of Korean and Japanese sushi restaurant. Our lunch special is perfect here. We have ordered the Kahlbee lunch box. It came with 4 pieces of California rolls, 3 pieces of sushi (tuna, salmon, and white fish), vegetables tempura, white rice and the main item Kahlbee - the Korean BBQ with short rib. I have been eating many lunch box special with California roll. This one has some Masago (fish egg) on top and makes it nicer. The Korean BBQ is grilled to perfect. The meat is tenderized and they not over grill to charcoal. Perfect meat seasoning. 

We also order the lunch special for additional two rolls with total less than $10. The spicy crunchy tuna and Unakyu Roll (eel roll in eel sauce). I prefer the seaweed to be wrapped outside than inside. The reason is the roll receives crunchy seaweed on the outside than soak and wet to be wrapped inside. The crunch tuna is delicious. They make good use of tiny pieces of tempura chips. Some use the crunchy noodle but I like this restaurant use the tempura chip is more authentic. 

The service is good. The restaurant did give us a special with 3 small Korean appetizers - Kimchi, fish cake, and egg cake. I love them all especially the fish cake. I would recommend for the lunch special and you can try variety of food with affordable price. I also like the combination of Korean food and sushi.

If you count the value, traditional, authentic, good dining at dinner, I would said 5 stars for this restaurant. I have been to this restaurant 5 year ago and it does not give me an impression of good Vietnamese cuisine. 

I have read many of my friend review about the pho, it is not the best. Why we revisit. I saw Joel review on the vegan food and decide to try it again. After I have read their menu, we discover the dishes that not normally serve in Pinellas Park Vietnamese hub. You need to navigate to their house special. Tonight we have a dish that we have try in Hanoi and did not see anyone doing it. The chargrilled fish. It is the grill fish "Thang Long" style. The fish is marinated with turmeric and baby dill. This dish we found at the street of old town Hanoi. Now we know they have it. 

We also order the autumn roll with fresh roll on grill ground pork. Interesting. We order the the authentic happy pancake with large rice crepe with pork, shrimp and bean sprout. It is very unique. The other dish include traditional Central Vietnam Rice Noodle. This is special noodle of the central Vietnam. That how it got the name. 

Overall they are good. I would suggest if you are here, don't try the pho for once. But try their house special menu.

Yelping 2400 -- Rare Ethnic Cuisine 59, Haitian Cuisine. 

Although they receive five star, they are actually 4.5 stars in my book. This restaurant is a take out place. Not sitting area or dine in. I was wanting to try this restaurant when they just open. I want to be the first review but some one beat me to it.

I got the goat in the sauce. This is goat with creole sauce. The goat is a bit smelly which mean the process do not include like soak in the milk to soften the smell. But the dish is still good. The second dish is the griot -- it is fried pork. This is popular item of the list. They have good fried systems. All dish come with rice and fried plantain. The rice have a choice of white rice and bean, mixed rice and bean or black rice. I would recommend the black rice. The black rice is actually their specialty. It is a mushroom rice. Very delicious. 

You need to be a little patient to come to this place. Because they cook all food right there. So it requires 15 minutes wait minimum from order.

Authentic Cuisine #61, Moroccan Cuisine 

We have been to Morocco and find this place is close to the cuisine we have tasted in Morocco. I like the Tanger sauce they have put over the rice. The use of spice is very similar. It is definitely a recommended restaurant to visit. The few things that I would comment on the restaurant. 1. Employees should use mask during pandemic. 2. Serve real plate instead of styrofoam box for the food if customers dine in. Other than that, they are great restaurant and good service to the local. 

We order two plate from chef special. The first dish is the Le Carnivore. This is the grilled skew steak and chicken. The steak was process and good tender. The chicken has the marinated spice into the meat. The hummus is like soft like the silk. They must take time grind and prepare this hummus. The Morocco shlada or "salad" is well prepared. Love it. Our second dish is the mermaid. This is grilled salmon and skew shrimp. This seafood combo dish. The shrimp is large and the fish is good. 

Our appetizer is one of the best falafel. The coating is fried to crispy. The inside is still green. Similar to the falafel in Morocco. The spice in falafel is very flavorful. Don't forget to order this appetizer.

#800 Review - Rare Ethnic Food 6 - Asian Fusion  

Got Zen!!!! You will find your food zen here. I was in search for worthy 800 review and find this restaurant. I got my inner Zen to write it. 

A successful business need to lean and mean. In other word is efficient and effective. We don't need a hostess for dead weight cost pass to the consumer. This restaurant do not specific has one but able to manage the reservation and scheduling. Does mean they don't have one but integrated the system in the waitress. They also don't need one floor manager which is effective. Not second hand sit around worker. Very efficient. Big applause to the restaurant with good business model. 

The food. Mmmmm good. Very good and reasonable pricing. We have order the Szechwan Cracked Peppercorn and Garlic Steak and the Shrimp Lo Mein. The shrimp Lo Mein is good but the steak is better. The steak is NY Strip with their spice rub and finished on the grill. Then it the sauce with pan fry garlic is added on the steak. Well balance on the taste. Steak is cooked to your order. 

The service is well train on the table side manner waitress. Pay attention to the detail of how to serve. Am I coming back- a big yes. I like to try their special night some time with Peking Duck Feast.

This ice cream replaces another ice cream store here before. Due to pandemic, they only allow take out. You can go in the store to see what you like and look at the ice cream you like. They have several selection. Currently they run a buy one get milk shake before 6pm. They also serve the ice cream sandwich. It is using cookie as sandwich. I saw many post their sandwich and look delicious. 

I am here for their waffle puff. I think it is the best deal here. I got three scoop of ice cream. We got the rum raisin. The ice cream has rich rum flavor. The next scoop is the black cherry. I got the good cherry chunk. The last scoop is the mocha caramel crunch. It has good dark chocolate candy. The waffle puff is great. It is good puff 

The entire thing is big enough to share. The puff is like a ball. Easily separate with ice cream. Mmmmm. It is good.

Yelping 1600, Rare Ethnic Food 42, India Street Food.

This one go to local restaurant who is the up coming stars in the area. I glad that they do their food like they do it in India. No take a back step to naturalize to American taste. It is India street food and it suppose to be like it was done in India. Only one level of spiciness. If you cannot take it, do not come here. This is not your typical American Indian food. It is real to the conditions which cook in India. 

With that said. I love the authenticity of the food. It is good spice. Marinated deep to the bone. We start with pani puri. It has shell crust outwardly and inwardly fill with cilantro, onion and tomato. This dish comes with the secret liquid to be pour into the opening of the crust. Then you enjoy the whole thing. It is out of body experience. I have the Apollo Fish. It is spicy and good. We also has the peppers chicken. It is very interesting to try it. 

Their menu is extensive. Go find out yourself. The vegetarian side is amazing too. At lunch, they have this Tali plate that is intriguing. Don't forget they have variety desserts. They are delicious. My next visit is definitely try their biryani.

Review # 2100
Authentic cuisine # 55. Fusion Venezuelan Cuisine 

We have been here fist time but they close early. It is difficult to visit this restaurant during weekday and you are 30 miles away. Finally we have a chance to visit. The restaurant space is small. So either you have the take out or visit them at odd hour like 2 pm after lunch hour. Because they always jam pack. 

Our first course is the 11 chick bowl. Great flavors. However I like the second dish with chick # 8 the Paisa. This arepa has fried egg, marinated beef, plantain, chorizo, avocado. Best combination. I like marinated beef inside. Great meal. Our last dish is sweet corn arepa with sautéed shrimp. The shrimp size is big and worth the money. 

We got the cappuccino top cinnamon powder. Great thick drinks. The rating is 5 due to great pricing, great food, and tasty.

A Korean bar and restaurant that interesting mixed. They have inside and outside seating. We did seat at the bar area to see all the action in the restaurant. We notice the chef is not Korean and they did a good job. 

We started with kimchi pancake. Normal Korean restaurant serve this dis in pie shape. They charge to triangle piece. I actually like their method because easy to bite and enable to fried on all corner of the pancake. My next dish is the beef bulgogi. This sizzling dish has good marinated sauce. I also like the banchan that go with it. It they can expand the number of banchan will be better. 

Service is ok. On point. The food is impressive. It is good concept to have small menu but do well on it.

The five stars rating is real per the yelper rated this restaurant. It is very easy to locate this restaurant because it is located at round about on the Central Avenue. They serve from noodle dish to sushi stack. Don't miss their lunch special. It is a steal. 

The lunch special has selection from one protein to 3 protein. Protein range from sashimi to chicken katsu. The side included sushi roll to house salad. 

We start with onigiri with spicy tuna and salmon avocado. I like the flavor mixed in. Our next dish tapas sample for two. This tapas dish include tempura shrimp and veggies, seaweed salad, squid salad, chicken pot stickers. Very much sample the appetizers. Our last dish is duck ramen soup. It is quite unique. The roasted duck lay on top of the ramen. The soup base is excellent and tasty. Definitely recommend this dish. 

This restaurant service is good. Definitely will visit again. It is also reasonable in price.

Great to see many Yelper gather and enjoy the fun time together. Thanks to TJ organize it. It was fun to see who like it, who cannot stand the smell or who cannot take the durian straight. 

Durian is king of the fruit in Asia. It look very pointy at outside. To open it, find the point of crust tip and hit it the ground to crack it open slightly. Than you can peel break it. Or use screw driver penetrate to the tip and pry it open. 

Some said this fruit look like the poop and some said is a golden nuggets. This fruit is either you like it or stay away of it. When fruit ripe correctly, it has an alcohol sweet taste. The sweetness is one of the kind that you cannot imagine. 

If you have durian at home, the people who visited your home will know that since the aroma of the smell will occupy the air space of your home. When the gardener or planter walk under the durian tree, they need to wear a helmet. The ripe durian actually fall to ground and that is the signed ready to eat. You don't pick durian from the tree. You wait until it fall to ground.

This is the oldest market in the country that founded 1791. Although they are not like ancient time but it offers a lot souvenir, food, hand craft, art, jewelry, drink, restaurant for the tourist. This is a fun place to be if you are looking for bargain souvenir. If you like the vender street food, this is a place to be. 

The market is open air market. Please be aware of the temperature since it is close to Mississippi River and will catch a lot of wind drift in cold weather. The restroom is pack with tourist during the Mardi Gras season. I would advise you to take the restroom at old US Mint. When they are open, they have the cleaner restroom for the ladies. It is just across the street at the end of market. No line!!!!! 

The vendor of art varies from many things. It ranges from clothing to front car display plate. During Mardi Gras season, the venders also located open sky concrete pad area. There are fantastic hand craft.

Please try their street food like fried cone or roast cone. These may be a must try item and they located at Mother Nature's Cupboard. Some of the venders sell crepe on the order, oyster and crawfish. Looking for special artist item such as one of the artists can bend the wire in different color to make a ring that can fit your exact ring finger size. My wife got a Mardi Gras color ring that is very unique.  

Some of the venders show up after 10 am. And that is the time the tourist show up also.

Buya will be easy to miss while you walking on the sidewalk of central Avenue. If you not look up to the sign, you will pass by thinking this is a bar. This is an interesting place that this store have special to offer. 

In the cold night with temperatures in the low 60, it is good to have a bowl of noodles soup. We saw the menu has some fusion Japanese ramen. It is creative. We order a bowl of Oxtail ramen to share. The waitress is kind enough to bring two small bowl for us. It not cheap but big enough to share if you like. 

The oxtail is braise then pan fried the outside to crispy. The soup is pork base but very different from tonkusu. The ingredients include two types of mushrooms. Soup with veggies and meat in very good harmony way. If you talking about soul of the cuisine, it has one. 

Service is good and attentive. They at least has good comfortable chair compared to some restaurant we have in Seminole heights.

This will be marked my end of double digit review (review 99). I will start my review by simply saying::great restaurant. Every time we pass by there is a line outside. The wait for dinner is 1 hour average. They don't take reservation. The best way to get to the restaurant is during their opening and during parade. We have found a trick to get to this restaurant. YELP has indicated the restaurant open at 11:00 am, they are actually open at 10:30. I am using this advantage to beat the crowd by 10 minutes to get a seat.    

Today lunch we have ordered the chargrilled oysters, fried crab craw, fried crawfish tail. The chargrilled oysters are season with garlic and salted and cook over the open flame. After you have eaten the oyster, you can dip the bread into the half shell to pick up the remaining seasoning sauce on the shell. Mmmm it is very good. The oysters here are better than the one we have in Florida. They are fresh and big. Somehow the swamp water breeds a better oyster. The fried crawfish tail is great to go with the beer. The fried blue crab craws are much better in this case. It is heavenly good. We were joking may be order to go order and sell with double price for the people who are waiting hour in line. 

Since they are open for lunch at 10:30 am, it is consider brunch. You actually can skip the breakfast at Cafe du Monde and come here for better food experience. I have pick this restaurant to be one of the best in New Orleans to close my double digit review.

These one of the few healthy store around the soho area. For the New Year, everyone is conscious on the intake of the food. New Year resolution play the major part of the goal this year. Soho Juice can be a solution to your goal. 

The have the healthy meal bowl that you can take home. Their juice program to clean your body also available. It has daily and weekly program. They are expensive. Not sure it worth the money. The product they carry include juice, meal, soft serve, Acai bowl, and more. I saw they have display gluten free, sugar free, allergy free, guilt free donut. Except they are not free of charge. Haha. 

We got the swirl chocolate and vanilla. This is special chocolate make with nothing taste like chocolate. But it is healthy. Our topping is the blue majits. It is actually blue honey. The entire soft serve is flavorful. Love it. It do not carry food coloring which stain your lip. They are actually 4.5 stars in my book.

It is adding a twist into this location. Today I found out they have added Token Ramen. Now we can call them street food of Asia. Kung Fu Tea already has the Taiwanese street food and drinks. Now by adding the ramen, they become my recommended visit restaurant. 

This update review put the restaurant to 5 stars because they are only one I know for Kung fu tea has Ramen. The chef here already has good skill for the Taiwanese food in compare to many Kung fu tea I have visited. I like the lunch special and the chicken nuggets. Those are the best. Now they added the ramen. I got the tonkutsu broth ramen. The soup is thick. It is flavorful. Love it. 

The area is big and accommodate a lot people including the patio seating. Service is good. I also like their boba drinks.

Rare Ethnic Food 43. Caribbean Smoke Jerk Cuisine. 

Usually you will see Jerk BBQ chicken. The chicken mostly grilled. This one has a twist with Caribbean Smoke Jerk Chicken. The chicken is marinated with the special house sauce. The marinated is to the bone. It was greatly prepared. As a result, when they are out of food, they close for the remaining day. They also has Smoke Jerk Pork. Both items are very delicious. I like the chicken wing a lot. I would said you got to eat there. Because, when they just take out from the Smoker, the skin is still crispy. That why you need to eat at the table or in your car. DELICIOUS. Now with that said. Some time by luck, you can have their specialty rack of lamb. My goodness, those are amazing. Check out my picture. 

Don't get disappointed if they close because they run out. I have actually try visiting this place three times before I actually got to try their food.

Great shave ice. Why....  it does not left the food color at you tongue. I like it very much. This store is about 4.5 stars not full 5 stars. If the service can have the smilies face to customers, probably 5 solid stars. 

This is a food truck in front of the plaza parking lot. I like they take an effort to fence it and decorated with plant and straw like umbrellas. It is good effort. We got Hawaiian Rainbows with passion fruit ice cream. It is definitely good for the picture. The shave ice was pile on the cup. The best thing is the color fruit flavors syrup was pull to bottom of the cup. Some other place they don't give enough syrup and the bottom shave ice did not receive it. Not this place. 

The passion fruit ice cream is unique. They have some other flavors I like to try next such as Allota Colada, Green Paradise, Onalicious.

Rare Ethnic Food No. 21

If you have been to Asia night market especially Taiwan or China, you will find this type of food. I am glad that Temple Terrace has established this restaurant that have this capability. This is classified as a street food. They are savory and good snacks. 

We are here for snack that is close 9:00pm. They have two type fried chicken. Fried chicken fingers or chicken row. You probably understand chicken fingers. Chicken row are fried bread chicken breast and cut into pieces. This is my favorite. The breaded coating is not normal flour. It is crispy and the Chinese spice is in it. They are very good taste. 

They also have curry items. But I am interesting on their pig feet, cool tilapia, and the Szechuan Sweet pork rib. I may have to come back to try it. 

I am excited to their price also. $3.89 for one whole box of chicken row. Very affordable. If you select the meal, you can ask the spring roll for the side and a soft drink come with it.

It is strange to name the restaurant four brothers. I wonder which brother. They have southern, middle eastern, Italian, pastry. I wonder each brother are different in cultures. This concept is definitely well accepted. 

Predominantly this is middle eastern food. We got the whole rusted chicken with two side. The chicken is marinated with yellow spice. It was split to half and grilled to perfection. I like the chicken with juicy meat. It is wonderful to eat. The side is amazing. We have dirty rice and baba ghanoush. The dirty rice has ground meat and sliced gizzards. Very interesting. 

The gyro is good. Not particularly impressed. If I visit next time, I would try their grilled snapper. It look interesting. This restaurant is 4.5 stars. Because the price match the food given.

It 4.5 stars not yet 5 stars. The reason they are good rating due to good pricing, good food, good ambient, and good service. It popular among the local. 

We start with spicy crunchy roll and eel roll. It it decent with 8 pieces each. Fish is good. Spicy tuna also good. We also got one of the specialty roll. It is the scallops volcano. The bay scallops was on top. The inside is the crab tempura. We also got a bento box sushi. It has 4 pieces of fish sushi, California roll, goyoza, rice and salad. 

Our experience here is great. Love the. We will be back.

This food truck live up their name as Gastrotruck. The Korean cuisine is exquisite. I have a chance to visit this truck due to festival. During the Tampa Japanese Summer Festival, their truck is one of the food truck show up. 

Their menu is simple, Kaarage $10, Chicken Teriyaki $8, Okonomi Tot $10, and the Gyudon for $11. All this is actually Japanese street food. I am appreciate they try to change their cuisine just for the festival. In fact, those dishes is quite good and colorful display. We got the Kaarage. This dish is chicken marinated in sake and soy sauce then deep fried with coating. They are quite good. The accompanying slaw also good. What a treat. It come with 5 big pieces chicken. 

The order to wait for the food is less than 5 minutes. They have enough man power for the food preparation.

It is about 4.5 stars in my book. It does bring something fresh to the community. Is it an art, ice cream, or beautiful treat? All of that. 

They have the gelato and ice cream section. I would go to the gelato because they are more interesting. We taste many flavor. I got the banana foster and bourbon gelato. This two flavors is excellent taste and not find elsewhere. Then you can choose the type of make up or just regular cone. For the experience, I would go for the makeup cone they have. We got the clown cone. This is with cotton candy. We take a part and eat those separately. 

By the way, extra scoop is only a dollar more. The clown cone is $7 and extra scoop make it to the $8. Not cheap, but they give good quantity of gelato to make up the price.

I like my time here. I would say this not a true 5 stars restaurant but very close to 4.5 stars. The place is cute. Two dining rooms setting. I was not going to have the high expectations. They have very good lunch special Monday to Friday. Approximately $9. Great deal. 

I did not go for the lunch special and go straight to one of their best dish. The cuisine is very similar to Black Forrest Germany cuisine when I have visited the Germany. I got the Schweinshax'n (pork Shank). It come with sauerkraut and bread dumplings. The sauerkraut was excellent. The dumplings is interesting that come as a cake pieces. 

The shank is braise and over roasted. They have lite seasoning outwardly. It is a big chunk. Great for hungry people. The pork sauce is great accompanied the bread dumplings and the pork shank. 

While I visited there, many have order the lunch special. Definitely a go to menu for lunch.

Rare Ethnic Food No.12

This is the series of five rare ethnic food at every 100 review I have made. I have selected Byblos due to their unique decorations and the unique cuisine Lebanese Cuisine.

Middle Eastern food is alway heavy in spice, marinated technique, and grilled timing. Byblos has these technique in high standard. I have the lamb chop and my wife has a mixed grilled. The lamb is the bone in lamb that is well cut and perfectly grilled. The marinated spice is well deep into the meat. This dish is my favorite. My wife have the mixed grilled. They are good also. But after you have the lamb, you will feel the lamb is more superior than the sheik kabab. 

The room is well decorated. Each room has it own character. The outside sitting include fire pit you can grilled you own. The interior include formal dining hall, bar area, private drape room. 

The service is good during lunch time. The lunch is certainly more affordable, but the dinner portion is a lot larger.

One of the treasures in St. Louis at The Loop Neighborhood is this Chinese restaurant. It is great to visit them if you are in St. Louis. They have boba tea and hand pull noodle. My wife like their hand pull noodle. I also like the boba or smoothie. I like the mung bean smoothie.

We begin the handmade wonton in chili oil. This dish dumplings is great. Love the chili oil and the wonton skin. Our second dish is their special beet dry handmade pan-fried lamb and cilantro dumplings. Just the name you already know this dish is special. I have not seen anyone serve this dish before. Because of the beet, the dumplings look red. Very interesting. 

Our last dish is the Pepper Chitterlings. Great wok technique with soften chitterlings. Great dish to go with rice. I enjoy every bit. The service is great. The food come out quick. You can see the chef hand pull the noodle and make the dumplings.

My second visit is pleasant. This time I am sit down have snack at dinner. I believe they are 4.5 stars restaurant not full 5 stars. Although I didn't try their ninja chicken nuggets again, but we do try fried calamari and the the black garlic ramen. They finally have the token ramen with newest ramen dish. Black garlic is one of the kind. It has the black sesame oil with black garlic on it. It is delicious. The calamari was fried very good with good coating. 

The reason they are upgraded is I make a challenge to their boba team. I ask a drink that partial in the menu but not totally in the menu. They have winter Mellon milk tea. I ask if they can do the slush. They said they have not done that before. But they will try. End up it is good drink.

I like Sandra. It is about 4.5 stars. If you come here, I recommend to get at least one link of their homemade sausage. This item is must have. They do have a table on the outside and few table inside. 

They do have combo meal, sandwiches, dinner plate and more. If you really want to try everything, they have built your own by pound or pieces. I like the build your own because I can try everything - pull pork, brisket, rib, chicken, catfish, sausage, rib and sides. The rib, chicken and brisket are delicious. The sausage is the best. 

The price is moderate. It is worth the money because of the taste and experience. If you like southern BBQ, this is a good choice.

Rare Ethnic Food #71. Tunisian Sweet. 

It is about 4.5 stars. I were here several time and they close for irregular hour. And pandemic. Finally I got to visit their store and try something that rarely found in the Bay Area. Tunisian sweet is temptation delight for the Mediterranean people. It is a good item for for tea time and more. It a crazy good sweet food but not too sweet. 

We have several interesting look sweet that is my first time try it. This sweet includes Chaba Kia shape like honeycomb and taste like rose water. Makroudh with dates infill item. Youyou like small sweet donut.  Ghrayba Hommos with hazelnut. The best is the pistachio cake. They are quite famous for that. Must try. 

Overall the experience is good. I can see to get use to it. Definitely come back for some other items.

Old school restaurant. They don't take credit card. However, they take check or cash. They also have no web side. This is a 4.5 stars restaurant since they don't take cash. However the food is good consider the good time per the name of the restaurant. Yelp don't have 4.5 stars. 5 stars is rated. 

Food cost is in the high side. There is a value for the art of cooking. The sauce and culinary art is good. The meat is well prepared. Tonight we have dinner with friends and I have the New York Strip with special gravy sauce - spicy Madagascar green peppercorns sauce flame with cognac. It came with sautéed mushrooms, green bean, potatoes. The mushrooms is well cook and brown.

My wife have the duck with cherry sauce. This is their signature dish according to Nick grandma. The duck is well braise. I like it when the meat is separated from the bone easily. This dish accompanied with green bean and rice. Yum. 

Service is great. Next time I will have the beer since they brew it since 1292.

Best value for NOLA food. 

Many of the menu item is fried but they are wonderful to try. I guess they got their name Crispy because the crispy fried items. This place is in my book mark for some time. Nick first go to this place without me. Now I come with him for the redemption. 

Since this is our fourth restaurants to visit today, we order something good for munch. We have Cajun fried gizzards, crispy catfish, Orleans beignets, and seafood gumbo. The best is the gumbo. It has good taste here. If you are here, just order one without sharing. Have it all for yourself. 

I like the catfish and the gizzards. The catfish was nicely batter and fried. The gizzards is soft and easy to eat. This is special item that not serve in normal item to many restaurants. 

The owner of the restaurant is nice and she know her cuisine. If you are here your soul for seafood gumbo will be retained in this place. Good luck.

This restaurant has some characteristics on the Thai cuisine. If you like very authentic taste, this restaurant has some. We like it because the material use on the dish is unique.

We have order the Tropical duck and grouper special for our entrees. We have the winter shrimp as appetizer. The winter shrimp is a good value. Most of the restaurant has this dish with one shrimp and tail. This restaurant has the whole roll fill with shrimps. 

The tropical duck with the meat fried to crispy. It has tropical fruit such as pineapple and lychee. It make it interesting but not wow me. However, they are good enough dish. The dish that wow me is the special grouper. It has a root slice item and green string like the lemon grass flavor. I couldn't make up the name of the two items. But they just make this dish so unique. 

I like the food of this store. Service is average.

It is my honor to introduce you the small business sandwich shop that is one of the top of my list. 

I have read many reviews for this shop and learn about the abbreviation of SSSS for name this shop. You also can said it translated to Sophisticate, Satisfaction, Special and Stylish sandwich. This four words are truly represent the food serve there.

We are trying their new sandwich that is not in the menu yet. We have the Arcade. It is quarter pound seared Ahi Tuna on the pretzel bun. The tuna is well seared on the out side with toasted sesame seed. The sesame seed was prepared very nicely with crispy and crunchy. It top with marinated sea weed salad and sriracha mayo. This sandwich is a keeper can be considered in the regular menu. Very sophisticate and special. It also come with a choice of side for $10.99. 

It you visit the shop, you will see the took picks on the ceiling. These took picks are the left over from sandwich. It becomes a transitional for this store. Service is friendly, food is good, price is right. They deserve to be 5 stars.

I come to Twennie home town but she has not review this place yet. I am surprised that I am reviewing ahead of her. 

The Tasty Pho is a very comfortable place to be compared to many Vietnamese restaurant in the Bay Area. Modern looking interior decoration and nice to eat and hangout. I forgot to ask if they have the Wifi. 

I have order the combination Tasty Beef Noodle pho and grilled shrimp sub Banh Mi Tom Nuong. The Tasty Beef Noodle is combination of slice beef, beef flank, beef ball, beef tripe and beef tendon. I like this noodle soup due to the tripe and tendon are big and whole piece. The soup has a bit of minty taste. The grill shrimp sub is sub is best one I have. The shrimp is include a bit black pepper and they are grill to perfection. The bun is toasted and crispy. Therefore they are easy to bite. 

Overall the experience is great. Like the pho and Banh Mi. Services is great and the interior is great.

The word for this restaurant is NOLA cuisine. This restaurant simply the best in Tampa Bay Area for serving the NOLA cuisine. We love our time here. The service is a bit slow. But the food are excellent. This place has vibe. If you come before 11:00 am order a drink, the beignets is free go with the drink. 

I like bar area. It has tight cool bar. This is a tiny place. The most you can seat inside is less than 40. Time to time they are pack. We have ordered beignets, Andouille Sausage, Red Grouper Bite, and the Seafood Gumbo. The beignets is just ok. But the rest of food are delicious. The red grouper is fresh and chunky. It accompanied with red cabbage slaw and sweet potatoes. This come with 4 different sauce. Yummy to try. 

The Andouille Sausage is slice into 4 thin slice. Serves over red bean and Louisiana style rice. The red bean was grind to liquid and serve with whole bean. The sausage is pan grilled to let the taste exhaust outwardly. The seafood gumbo is insanely good. It has shrimp, scallops, Andouille Sausage, crab, grouper, okra, pea. The gumbo sauce take you out of your mind. If someone looking for Louisiana cuisine, I will certainly point this way. 

Too good. So try yourself. Mike drop experience.

For the lunch, they deserve the five stars. This is about 4.5 stars restaurant. This restaurant is new kid at the block at this southern Riverview. Restaurant location at Apple map is incorrect and I have reported them. The Yelp page was correctly show the restaurant location. 

If you looking for value lunch, this is the place. I have their lunch special with maki lunch. The cost is $9. Two rolls with a choice of soup or salad. I got the spicy tuna and and salmon skin rolls. Both rolls come at 8 pieces. They are good size. I hope they keep it up. 

I also go an app Mixed Tempura. It come with two tempura shrimp, four tempura veggies and one tempura broccoli. They have the best broccoli tempura which not over coating the broccoli. Very good technique. The dipping sauce bowl is big enough to accommodate the tempura pieces. Shrimp is great. 

I don't need to wait for my food. I finish in less than 35 minutes for lunch. Good value entree and app for $15.

Mad scientist or creative chef. Do you have to decide the final outcome for the food lab. It is actually experiment food?  Mmmm. Let see the dinner out come. We have our company holiday dinner there with design menu. It is not cheap but very worth for the trip. 

Our request menu is a four course night with starting the cold appetizers at the first plate. My wife have the almond coconut gazpacho - it is coconut rock shrimp with Fuji Apple salpicon in green curry oil. This a cold soup. The rock shrimp is nice and creative in the soup. The soup base is not normal gazpacho and is white. It is good. I have the avocado leaf seated yellow fin tuna. This is the best of the cold app. It come green mango salad, aji amarillo sorbet, fish sauce caramel and tamarind peanut crunch. It creative that the sorbet replace the wasabi and the fish sauce caramel replace the balsamic reduction sauce. Now you know why they call themselves food lab. 

The second course are the hot appetizers. I have smoked maple glazed pork belly. It top with hoe cake, black eyed peas, green tomato chow-chow. Usually I don't care about hoe cake but sauce and other ingredients combine, it is great. The pork belly is cook perfectly. If you are not good chef, do not try this dish because it need three part meat harmony. My wife has Serrano ham zeppole. The slice hams were place on top of rosemary doughnuts with compressed melon, Saba and Parmesan snow. Interesting dish. The rosemary was deep fried to crispy with seasoning. I have not have it this way before. 

Our third course are the main dishes. I have the red snapper a la plancha. It is fillets snapper with sautéed and glazed on top on avocado coconut grits, baby spinach, mergers marmalade, avocado chutney and mango harissa purée. This best main dish tonight the purée go very well with the fish. My wife has the painted hills short rib 'sancocho'. Usually the Caribbean sancocho is a mix of meat and veggies soup. This is an overhaul design for the short rib with boniato, yuca, sweet potato, and sweet corn, green plantain,avocado toss watercress, and cilantro sweet garlic juice. I only can said - it is good. 

The final course is the sugar crusted butter cake or chocolate peanut butter bar. Both of them is great. I the butter cake because the cake form the caramelized sugar crust on all expose wall. The cake is syrup and is good. 

The only thing is the food take a bit time to come out for the first dish. The rest are good. The service is great. The drink you have to refer to the pic since we don't know what they have created.

This restaurant locate at downtown St. Pete close to the museum of fine art. Since this is a Thursday night with museum special deal after 5 pm ($5 per adult, normal $17), after museum, we decide to come to this restaurant.
