The store front is a open bar. The time we were there is about six and they can sit you immediately. After 30 minutes, there is already a waiting line. Please come before six if you don't want to wait for sit. Bella already extend their sitting area with capacity, however if you are late, you will need to wait.  Among all the restaurant at downtown, they are the most reason in price for the food. 

Today I order the menu with "secondi" category - marinated skirt steak and my wife order the grilled chicken pasta. The item in the "secondi" came with soup of the day or salad. This is better deal. The $22 skirt steak came with two side and a soup. Good deal. The soup of the day is minestrone sausage soup. It is bean base, dice tomatoes, dice carrot, and chop pasta in crush tomatoes base. I believe they have added the oregano and basil to enhance the flavor. It make the soup well balance and interesting. 

The skirt steak is marinated with sweet sauce and serve with mash potatoes and grill broccolini. The broccolini is very impress. They broil, grill and stir fry in the process with garlic sauce with a hint of spicy chili. This make the food sophisticate. The skirt steak is grill to your order and slice to the bite size. 

The whole proceed of serving is ok. It is slow in the beginning but it pick up at the end. The extend area may be good for company Christmas party. It deserve for full stars due to to chef cooking skill, service, clean bath room and good pricing.

Craft Kafe is an interesting restaurant with many flavor. With the restaurant next door to organic grocery store, they can get the fresh ingredients immediately. You also can eat healthy here since they have organic items. 

Definitely stop here for breakfast. I usually not a breakfast person but got to try their breakfast since many reviews indicate they are good. We have order an omelette and two coffees. I have the latte and my wife has cappuccino. I have ask them to decorate the cream in artist way and she did impressed me. Coffee is good and better than Starbucks. 

The omelette we order is the craft omelette. It come with spinach, chicken sausage, mushrooms. It accompanied with hash browns and toss. It is quite tasty. 

The cafe also have other item such as fresh squeezed juice, quiches, vegan pumpkin bread and more. If I pass by here again, I will check them out.

Agree with Mark for the tasty food and fast service. I think it is more like 4.5 stars restaurant then actual 5 stars. I wonder why they have to be located at Soho area, why don't they locate near USF area to attract more students and the Busch Garden tourist. Soho already has so many restaurants, I think their pricing is good for the students. 

I will start with their side selection. They have several selection I like. The roasted vegetables, braised white bean and Greek salad is good. For the Greek salad selection is free with kabab. Other combinations need to add $1.69. Tonight we have the steak and salmon kabab. Both of them is flavorful. The steak is in sweet marinated sauce. The reason they get half stars less due to the meat quality,  it is chewy. The salmon was perfect. It come with zucchini in the skew and the salmon juice dip into the zucchini and make it more sophisticated. 

The price is right. I like they use the actual silver ware instead of plastic ware. The place is typical fast food. Definitely will be back.

It is about 4.5 stars for my visit. Round up to 5 stars. We were here about the burger week. They are serving the Jamaican Me Crazy burger. Only this occasion they serve this kind of burger. This burger is top with grilled pineapple, applewood smoked bacon and mango purée. Very tasty. The patty of meat is grass-fed beef. The patty cooked to edge crispy and medium to center. Very good preparation on the grilled. 

If I revisit again, I will try their salmon burger and mushroom and Swiss burger. These two burger will be in my future visit. I also like the burger cook on the order which make the burger really fresh.

The super bowl night and we decide to sit at the bar side of the Bonefish Grilled.  The new added menu for the Bar Bites Menu has added another dimension for the order. The items start at $4 to $12. The bar bites menu have 8 selection and some of the selection have two different type of meat. The appetizer has 11 items to select. The combination of the bar menu and the appetizer create over twenty different selection. This is good business model with Tapas mentality that the bonefish management has provided the customer with more choice. It definite makes the top bar in this area. It will attract more customer in the future.

Tonight we started with the Lamb Lollipop hops. I have this dish at different Bonefish location and I want to make sure different chef can create this dish better. The lamb chop turns up better at this location. The meat is cook to perfect medium and have hint of salt to make the chop taste better without losing it meat taste. We have order the Lobster Street Taco. My wife like this dish and said it have big chunk of lobster meat and worth the $5 item. We have order a bowl of the corn chowder with crab meat. I will advice you order the bowl instead of the cup when you are hungry or two people in the party that can share this dish. The cup and bowl size only a $1 different and you get more on the bowl. We have gone to the appetizer menu and order the Filet Satay. This is new item in the appetizer. It is a center cut filet mignon in soy seasoning and serves with spicy mustard sauce in tomatoes, cucumber, onion.  The meat is tender and soft. The only down side is each pieces is small. However they are delicious. The next appetizer is Singapore Calamari. The calamari is lightly dry pepper breaded and deep fried. It serves sweet spicy sauce. They are crispy and we have left nothing on the plate because they are insane good. The last item is the coconut shrimp with sweet spicy sauce. The dish has six jumbo shrimp and coated with coconut flake. This is a good value dish and it is less than $9. 

We are stuff after all the items. I forgot to mention the Sunday night have happy hours till 6:30. The wine is $3.25 a glass and the draft beer is a dollar. Can't beat that!!! Our server is super nice and attentive. As a result, tonight we are awarding this restaurant with 5 stars.

This is a grocery restaurant with an interesting ideal. I know the grocery store with restaurant is not the new ideal but a grocery store with great Japanese goods and great restaurants is the first. I would said this is the restaurant to be. 

You can order the food then shop while you wait for your food to be ready. We got a lot Japanese item which cannot be founded in Tampa. For the restaurant we order the chirashi. It is a rice with assorted sashimi tuna, salmon, octopus, unagi, ikura, egg, hokkigai, kanikama, white fish. Very delicious. Second dish we have is the tonkutsu ramen. This pork bone soup is nice and tasty. It has the roll pork belly. Next is my favorite with Cajun shrimp roll. The shrimp is soft shell. It is deep fried to a point the the head and tail is crispy to eat. Basically you cat the entire shrimp with shell and head. The roll is delicious with the Cajun sprinkles. 

It is authentic Japanese food here with a twist.

It is about 4.5 stars. Not yet 5 stars. This is a place that young and beautiful gatherings place. Great to many young people participating the lunch. With University of Tampa next to it, many students eat here. I like this place because it has variety of shops in one place. They have bookstore, champagne bar, coffee bar, the shop, commerce club upstairs. Very interesting to host many variety. 

We enjoy the restaurant area. For lunch, their food selection is flatbread, sandwiches, small plate, breakfast and salad. Simple but elegant. We got the steak sandwich and tomato prosciutto flatbread. The steak sandwich has a sauce along caramelize shallot in it make the tasty. The flat bread prosciutto is chop piece with pesto sauce which is delicious. Our experience is great. Definitely come in the future. Serve is average. Once the server engaged, we have good service.

Yelping No. 2000!!!

Rare Ethnic Food # 50. Russian and Ukrainian cuisine. 

This little restaurant just opens no long ago. I already like it very much. It is one of the kind in Tampa Bay Area. You have to experience it for it wonderful cuisine. The restaurant locates near USF which make sense for many Russian students study there. The day we have visited, not many customers. It need great word of mouth to spread a good news. 

The menu is simple and delicious. The display in the restaurant is nice with Russian doll. They have the bakery good next to the counter. The only thing I would complain is the chair is too tight. 

What is meaning of "Babushka". It mean triangular folded kerchief for head or it also mean grandmother. Many Russian doll has kerchief over it is part of long tradition. It also can mean your grandma kitchen. Take your pick. 

Our first dish we have order is the Borscht. This is a famous soup with meat, sautéed veggies and beet root. The beet make the entire soup red color. The soup is great during winter. It top with the rosemary. The second dish is Blinchiki. This is a tradition wheat crepe wrap the meat inside. Very unique in many way. 

Our third dish is the Russian dumplings. They have three different fillings inside the dumplings. The Lamb, Beef and Pork. We mixed the pork and beef with the soup base. I like the most is the pork. I would suggest order with soup options. The fourth dish is the Syrniki. This is a pancake made from cheese and wrap with meat options. I like this one too. 

Our fifth and final dish is the Kotlety. It is three minced meat croquettes with a side. We have chose Russian brown rice

Overall our experience have exceed our expectations. It was marvelous meal we have at the dinner. It deserves a 5 stars attention. I would said you may need to change your taste bud when you come to this place. Many items is less sodium. But the taste still there. Russian like to use the sour cream. But I don't.

The name matches what they serve. Mr. Penguin definitely a cold serve. We are welcome the cold serve in Florida since we have hot weather most of the time. 

I like thank Nick to show this place to us. We like their combination of the Italian ice with the soft serve ice cream. This combination is work for me. I have the vanilla soft serve with the bubble gum flavor Italian ice. They put them in layer. We actually can pick to flavors of Italian ice but I didn't do it since I like bubble gum flavor. The ice cream with the two type of mix calls gelati. I like Mr. Penguin creative bring other sensation to the community. 

The soft serve can be vanilla, chocolate or the swirl of two flavors. The Italian ice has a lot to select. You can ask for the try out taste before you make your order. This place is dog friendly.

In search of the taco place. I look up Dianna review and decide to try this place. You can said is unique place in the Bay Area with authentic Mexican food. I have not seen our recent taco crazy taco queen Kristal checkin to this place. I finally have a place to bit her to the punch. 

It was surprise to me this place have good taco at very economical scale. I have three tacos and a margarita for total of $11. I have the steak, pastor and lamb. This is the first time I have the lamb taco. It is very different than other taco place. Very tasty. It come in chunk. Good in value for this taco. 

The other two taco is not bad either. During the weekday including Friday, they run the two margaritas for $5 from 2:00 pm to 7:00 pm. Very good deal. With economical pricing, friendly serving, and good food, they deserve 5 stars.

Rare Ethnic Food No. 19

Indian biryanis is an beautiful like Chinese fried rice.  Chinese use the soy sauce with other ingredients. The Indian biryanis is using the Indian spice mixed with meat. The liking of how biryanis taste is up to each individual. Some like heavy spice with hot chili and some like it mild with touch of spice. 

The selection of biryanis here is a lot. Start with egg biryanis, boneless mutton, paneer veggies, Kheema, anthrax chicken, Avakai, ulavacharu and more. We have order regular chicken biryanis and Avakai biryanis. Tha avakai include mango pickle. Very interesting. I like it spicy hot. But if you feel is too hot, they have yogurt on the side. 

Service is good, the biryanis is excellent. Good enough spice. My wife said it is to hot after 5 spoon full. Love to come back to try them all.

It is not yet full 5 stars. It is about 4.5 stars in my book. The reason they are 4.5 stars is the value of the food vs the quality and taste of the food make the list above 4 stars. A reasonable price with decent food. 

I started with the Guanabana Juice. It has great fruit smell. Mixed with 2% milk make this drink very desirable. We also has the shrimp empanada. This my first time with the shrimp infills. Very interesting. We got the Fish Fritter. The fish is salty fish. It is another interesting dish. 

Our entree are the tilapia and steak mofongos. Tilapia is ok. The steak is better. The mofongo is good because they are cooking with pork material inside. The mofongo is better than other place I have tasted. Because it is soft and no dry - the key of good mofongo. 

We end up with home made churros and coconut flan. Great balance of flavor. I will revisit them because they have reasonable price.

I love downtown. But most of the time is difficult to find great food with reasonable price. Fusion Bowl has solved many lunch office workers with affordable price. The location also is prime location next to county office building. 

I was surprised we able to find a "great" drink place with decent food. The drink. I have the mixed berry with condensed milk with coffee jelly. This is great drink. This drink has many berry type and herb. We also has a good lavender drink and mango drink. All these drinks were good. But the mixed berry is the best. 

I got the beef noodle pho, lemon chicken fresh roll and grilled pork bowl. I said they are decent and acceptable. The quantity enough for lunch and better than fast food.  Lemon chicken is good to start. 

The store owner was friendly. I like this small business. They have a lot customer visiting during Sunday lunch. Imagine weekday afternoon.

Yelping 1900. Authentic Cultural Food No. 47. Center East Chinese Cuisine

This restaurant use to call Tao Asian Fusion. Recently has changed their name. The menu is also changed. This restaurant basically has Shandong and Peking cuisine. Very close to Szechuan cuisine. This area of China eat slightly different from other side of country. Since it is at the capital, the cuisine includes many area of China due to dynasty dining. 

I like many items in the menu and the special of the day. It has an attractive menu. We got the sautéed pig kidney. The chef is skillful not to let the ingredients over cook. It is nice to see to serve this dish right. Our next dish is the beef noodle with pickle veggies. The beef is marinated and braised for some time. 

We also got the fish with black bean sauce. This black bean sauce with chili is a nice combination. The fish is fried with whole fish no head. So you need to skill eater to order this dish. Our last entree is the Dong Po Pork. I love this dish when they prepared correctly. This is Pork belly with skin and braised in sweet sauce. It need to be braised over time to soften the tough skin and meat. Which they have done that. I would recommend this dish if you come to visit. 

We order the beef pie from the special menu. It is special street food category. If they carry this dish. Order the pork pie. Overall experience is excellent. Enjoy the good cooking. We have been back twice.

4.5 stars restaurant. Not yet 5 stars to my book. This restaurant has plus at back of the name. This mean they beyond just poke only. The restaurant also has the Vietnamese cuisine. So you can get poke and cook meal. I got best of both worlds. 

I start with mixed poke. I got the base as rice and protein as tuna. They are generous for one scoop of protein. This is why they have 5 stars. I got all the mixed in ingredients and topping that have have no up charge. The sauce are poke sauce, eel and special ask for sesame oil. It was really good for mixed in. I would pre them to do mixed in ingredients and protein separately than added into the base then add topping. But they don't have this procedure. They do put the sauce over base then on top of mixed in ingredients. This area they can improve. 

We also got the combination pho and grilled pork bun. Their Vietnamese side food also delicious. The grilled pork is well marinated and their pho is deep with herb smell.

#ThankYouThursday. 

I have chosen Terra Gaucha for today visit for lunch dine in experience. Thank you for hanging there during pandemic. I think your restaurant has good high ceiling dining hall. No doubt the great Brazilian Grille in Tampa Bay Area. We were lucky to have you. Interior design is great. Good place for power lunch and bring the the client. 

With that said. This is place for meat. Love it. Buffet style. People may be afraid of close contact because of buffet. Thank you to make it safer for people come to the table. Before each individual come to the buffet booth, each one need to put on the hand gloves. So the share spatula is not touch. The buffet table already have partial cover on top. But I think more cover or complete lid cover is better. We saw a few completely cover such as soup item is very good. 

The meat bring to the table is well perform. Server wear gloves and mask. Definitely great to visit. Keep serving our community and we are looking forward to see you again.

Currently the restaurant are not open for public to dine in. It is takeout only. In order to attract customers and regularity, they push out several rewards systems. They have clover points system. 50 point cumulative got the free peach pudding with milk. 100 point got Tao Beef Burrito, 200 point spicy chicken and 300 whole grilled fish. Basically is 10% off item you cumulative as point. 

The also run weekly half price promotions. Currently is the grilled lamb leg half price. You can choose spicy or salt and pepper. I prefer the salt and pepper. It is delicious. Other item include dong Po pork belly, fiery shrimp are among the best. You should try those dishes. The lunch special is comparable with and fast food outside with great value. It also includes a soft drink and make the deal sweet with about $8. Can beat that. 

Call ahead is the key. They usually need 20 minutes to prepare. Food are very nicely seasoned and go with wine at home. Are you hungry now.

Review #2900. Rare ethnic food #70. Iraqi Cuisine. 

This review go to our local unique restaurant. I have many Middle Eastern food but this one is different. If you come to visit, I would suggest get the Iraqi Masgouf fish dish. The restaurant has very interesting meat dish in the menu. All food is interesting. 

We got the Iraqi Masgouf. This dish is not cheap but it has good quantity and quality. The entire come with marinated grilled fish. The side dish have Fries, green chili, butter bread, two mixed veggies, and more. The fish is delicious with bone. The other dish we have is the  dolce ribeye steak. This dish we select the rice. I like the spice up rice. The steak was well marinated. It is tasty to the bone. 

The restaurant has a yellow bird. It sing for us while we are eating. The chai tea is complimentary. The soup was special complimentary. We got the lentil and the okra soup. Service is good. Love to eat there for good food. The bread is special with their own made butter.

This is brand new Brazilian Steakhouse. It is a chain restaurant with well train staff to get this restaurant run smoothly at the first month. The lunch is cheaper than the dinner. The all you can eat steak also includes all you can eat buffet for other miscellaneous items. 

The steak is awesome. Especially I like the lamb chop, chicken heart, skirt steak, top sirloin. All steak is well seasoning. Especially the chicken heart and chicken drum stick. The chicken drum stick is marinated in wine sauce. Very delicious. There are wave and wave of meat to cut. They also bring out big giant leg of lamb. 

During this time on the brand new opening, they have 10% off the bill. On the buffet table, they have heart of palm, Smoke salmon, caramel mushrooms and more. 

Tip - don't forget to ask for the steak sauce such chimichuri, hot sauce, mint jelly to go with steak and lamb chop. 

Service is excellent. These include the speed, attention to detail, clean up, and frequently check on the table. Definitely 5 stars.

Rare Authentic Food #38 - Florida own seasoning crab. 

I am surprised Nick and Tina did not smell this one out since both of them love crab. This restaurant now is my number one store to go finger food for crab. It is king of the crab store. Best ever. If you want some finger food during this football season, this will be the one if you don't mind to get down dirty with finger for limited crab meat. 

Today I got two types of crab. The garlic crab and fried crab. Both of them are excellently exceedingly my expectations. The garlic crabs are finger licking good. 3 crab for $7.50. I also got the seasoning fried crab for $11. Man!!! Those are good. The seasoning is deeeeeeeeep into the crab since the crab is minorly crack to allow the seasoning get into the crab meat. They have other item. But I think you should concentrate on the crabs. 

Am I coming back. Hell yes!!!! Love the food. By the way this is just a take out store. You can order 15 minutes ahead so it won't be any wait. The crab is fresh. The fried crab is normally bigger than garlic crab. There is not sit down area. Only carry out.

Yelping 1400 - Rare Ethic Food # 41

This one go to the local restaurant which is unique in many way. This Turkish kitchen offer many items I have never seen before. It is amazing to try them all. I would recommend friends to try this restaurant which is extremely good. 

To begin, we start with oven baked Hummus with added Turkish sausage. This hummus is mixed with mozzarella. This dish come with lavash bread. This is my first time have this dish. It is huge bread. The bread blow up is actually made up of hot air trap inside that bigger than my head. It is interesting. 

The main dishes include Levrek- Whole Mediterranean Sea  Bass. The fish is grilled. I like the crispy fish skin with the marinated sauce. The fish is fresh and great to enjoy. The second dish is Pirzola - marinated grilled lamb chop. It come with 4 chops. Very good flavor. 

We end the night with special dessert. The Kunefe is one of the specialty of the night. It is string type Filo Dough stuff with cheese and sugar syrup. It was interesting to pull them apart. String dough make the this dessert unimaginable delicious. 

Overall this is solid five stars restaurant. Good service.

It is about 4.5 stars. Onur is part market and part restaurant. This is a Turkish market for item like Turkish delight and all the Turkish goods such as tunas jam, coffee, spices, flour, marinated steak and more. 

We got some of the cookies and milk drinks mixed and a kabab to go. We have the chicken kabab and it comes with veggies. You will not believe the kabab is good. Love the juicy chicken kabab. 

The menu of the restaurant was easy to select. The price is affordable in compare to full middle eastern restaurants. The kabab was prepared in ten minutes. In compare to restaurants I usually waited for half hours. This is the plus to prepare the food quick and quality.
